dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norchester is a beautiful, leafy suburb of Boston. Kids r bikes. Dads walk dogs. Neighbors chat with each other. An the middle of town sits

dialogues.speaker: THE NORCHESTER SCHOOL
dialogues.text: Surrounded by playgrounds and lush fields, Norchester is public school we all wish our kids could go to: dynamic teachers, motivated students, winning sports teams, every type of arts program imaginable -- it’s perfect.

dialogues.speaker: A LINE OF MINIVANS DISGORGE HUNDREDS OF K-12 CHILDREN
dialogues.text: in front of the school as WELL-DRESSED MOMS load up their precocious KIDS with backpacks, lunchboxes, and science projects before kissing them goodbye. Then

dialogues.speaker: A TOTALLY BUSTED 1985 TOYOTA CELICA
dialogues.text: thunders up to the school blasting HIP HOP and billowing SMOKE from its tailpipe. The car rumbles to a stop and a 15 YEAR OLD with a mullet and ripped jeans get out--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM THE CAR
dialogues.text: Hey dum-dum you forgot your lunch! A bag of McDONALD’S flies out of the car. The giant kid catches the bag and shambles off towards the school. Fina we reveal the MOM driving the Celica:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA DUNKLER
dialogues.text: She's wearing a low cut silver lamé top, no bra, sunglass and she couldn’t give a fuck. FREEZE FRAME on Carla light up a cigarette as we smash the title over her face:

dialogues.speaker: BAD MOMS
dialogues.text: UNFREEZE as camera captures all of the other MOMS’ horrif reactions to Carla. They shake their heads, disgusted...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA JUST FLIPS THEM ALL THE BIRD
dialogues.text: as she roars off down the street. The camera STAYS WITH t beautiful, super-fit, super-rich alpha mom of the school

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN JAMES
dialogues.text: as she watches Carla drive off. She turns to her two best friends, VICKY LATROBE, not so bright, and MEAN STACY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman is a fucking cancer.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Why can’t you get them kicked out of the school, like you did with the Mandel’s?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Because she’s one-sixteenth Chickasaw Indian, and you can’t fuck with that kind of diversity. (scowling after Carla) No, that bitch is bulletproof...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Couldn’t you find another Indian to replace Carla?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Vicky, I’m the President of the PTA, I’m not Kevin fucking Costner, okay? I can’t just blow my ram’s horn and make more Indians appear. Mean Stacy frowns at a CLUSTER OF MOMS nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Oh gross look: all the Attachment Moms are wearing harem pants today. The ATTACHMENT MOMS, long hair, BABIES in slings, HIPPY K at their feet, walk up the path wearing baggy harem pants

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Those bitches better vaccinate their filthy children or I swear to God I will go off-- (waving sweetly to them) Hey Meg! Hey Shar! Love your pants! The ATTACHMENT MOMS wave back, friendly, heyyy!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, the Tiger Moms are late today. Three anxious TIGER MOMS hurry their stressed CHILDREN up walk to the school, wheeling suitcases full of books.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Violin Camp must’ve run late this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at their fucking kids. They look like hostages. (smiling, to Tiger Moms) Hey Karen call me! ONE OF THE TIGER MOMS waves sweetly as she hurries past.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Oh God pretend to look at your phones here comes that weird stay- at-home mom. A dorky stay-at-home mom, KIKI, approaches wearing a cardigan, mom jeans, and a desperate smile. She herds TWO SMALL KIDS and a pair of BABY TWINS. Gwendolyn’s crew qui looks at their phones, trying not to make eye contact, bu Kiki walks right up to them, barely holding it together:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Hey guys how are you guys?!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh hey Kiki, how are y--

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I’m amazing Maddie was up all night barfing on my hair but I’m great I’m so happy--!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Awesome well have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Also Bernard has night terrors he’s really not doing okay--!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Great I’‘1ll see you at the bake sale-

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Hey I was going to get a fun coffee after this it’s like the only thing I do for myself every day do you want to come with me?!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh, I'd really rather not but thank you! Kiki nods, pained/happy, and shepherds all of her kids towards the school. Gwendolyn exhales, watching Kiki:  GWENDOLYN (CONT’D) Jesus she’s like two days away from driving her kids into a lake. Just then a MINIVAN squeals up and the hero of our story

dialogues.speaker: AMY MITCHELL
dialogues.text: scrambles out, chic in a skirt suit. Amy hurries her two kids, DYLAN, 10, sweet, lazy, and JANE, 16, anxious over- achiever, out of her minivan. She smiles at a PASSING MOM

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: And here’s Amy, late as always...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I love how hard she works.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, such a hard worker.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I just fucking said that Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: ON AMY
dialogues.text: as she ushers her kids up the path towards the school, handing them a comically large amount of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, here are your lunches: organic turkey club for Jane and gluten free peanut butter and jelly with low salt yam chips for Dylan-- She hands TUPPERWARE PLATTERS OF DELICIOUS FOOD to each o her kids. They take them, unimpressed and ungrateful.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: What are yam chips?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, the school sent an email saying that yams are more sustainable than potatoes but to be totally honest I don’t know what sustainable means I just don’t want to get in trouble with the crazy food moms. Oh, and Dylan, here's what I made for your American History project-- She hands Dylan an AMAZING THREE FOOT PAPER-MACHE HEAD O RICHARD NIXON. Dylan takes it, again unimpressed by his m amazing handiwork, as they near the school entrance...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I love you guys so much. Amy kisses both of her kids, emotional--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Not so loud, mom, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: BABIES
dialogues.text: Jane and Dylan race into school, embarrassed, as Amy grin

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Hey Amy! Amy looks over, sees Gwendolyn and her crew, and smiles:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh hey! How are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you do it, leaving your kids and going to work every day. You’re so strong.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks--

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Don’t you just miss them?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I do, but I also need like, money--

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: I had a job once but I didn’t love it so I quit.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: I design jewelry!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ Vicky stop saying that like it’s a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay well, I’m late for work, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always late.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, it’s basically the only thing I’m good at these days! Bye! They say goodbye. Gwendolyn watches Amy race off, trouble

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: She’s so likeable. The moms shudder, equally disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BOSTON/INT. AMY’S MINIVAN -- MORNING Amy ROCKETS through downtown Boston like Jeff Gordon at Talladega. She cuts across three lanes of traffic as HORN BLARE. She waves -- sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee for the People is a hip, free-trade, super-lefty coffee company. The office is all reclaimed wood and glas and the average age of the employees is 22. HIP YOUNG GUY play ping pong, HIP YOUNG GIRLS ride scooters and chat ov cappuccinos at the espresso bar. Work is so fun! Then Amy blows into the office, harried. TESSA, 20's, Amy assistant with straight bangs falls into step with her:

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: Hey man.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Good morning Tessa.

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: The masseuse is here today, you want a shoulder rub?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God I would love that, but I don’t have time. Thanks though-- They hurry into

dialogues.speaker: AMY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: It’s a classic Working Mom’s Office: photos of her kids everywhere, desk in complete disarray. Just as Amy and Tessa enter, DALE KIPLER, 24, the too wa young, way too cool CEO of the company follows them in:

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Morning!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh hey Dale -- what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: I had a dream last night. I was naked in a hotel room... Like totally naked, balls and everything-

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yup got it.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: And I walked over to the coffee maker in my hotel room...and I saw a bag of our coffee there.

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: Cool dream Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Thanks Tessa.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So...is this your way of saying that you want to start selling our coffee to hotels now?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: No. This is my way of saying that I want you to start selling our coffee to hotels now.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay. Well, I’m already running all of our sales to supermarkets, restaurants and airlines, is there maybe someone else, like one of the guys who plays ping pong all day, who could run this? Dale looks out at the young hipsters playing ping pong...

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Amy. Listen to me. We’re all equal here. I’m no better than you and you’re no better than me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you’re way better than those guys, do you know what I mean? I can’t trust them with one of my really cool dream ideas.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Right, but breaking into the hotel market is going to take a ton of work, and I’m sort of part time, remember?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: You are? Since when?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Six years ago?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: No way! You’re always here!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, but I have a family...and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Dude: I love family. That’s why I wrote it on my arm: Dale shows her a Gothic forearm tattoo that reads “FAMILY

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tight, right?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I guess--?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Cool, let me know how many hotels you can close by Friday. (exiting, stops) Oh hey, you coming out with us to lunch? We’re doing Barbecue & Bowling!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No...? I’ve got to work?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Love that. You guys really are the Greatest Generation. Amy just watches him exit, baffled...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss working with grown-ups.

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: Dude how the fuck are you gonna do this hotel thing on top of all the other work you have? Amy rubs her temples, overwhelmed with stress...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I have no idea... What’s my schedule for today?

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: Well, you’re already late for your marketing meeting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Amy runs into a CONFERENCE ROOM where a meeting is in progress. She smiles apologetically. The PRESENTER glares

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then you've got a sales pitch to the TDI restaurant group... -- Smiling, professional, Amy offers taster cups of coffe SEVERAL GRAY-HAIRED EXECUTIVES, who nod, impressed...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then you've got lunch at your desk while you write your annual sales report... -- Typing furiously, Amy eats a pathetic lunch from tupperware at her desk. Out her window, she watches ALL T YOUNG PEOPLE in her office heading to lunch in MATCHING BOWLING SHIRTS, laughing. Amy frowns and keeps working...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After lunch, you have Zumba... -- Dressed in Lululemon, dripping with sweat, Amy Zumbas class full of working women. She looks seriously nauseous

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Which is obviously not the ideal time to Zumba, but it's the only time I could fit it in... The CLIPS of Amy’s day start cycling faster and faster...  10.

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then you've got a meeting with the creepy guys from corporate... -- Back in her suit, Amy races into a meeting full of CRE CORPORATE GUYS who all leer at her lasciviously...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Followed by a second meeting to discuss how the first meeting went... -- Looking highly confused, Amy races into another meetin a different office with exactly the same people...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: After that, you've got a parent- teacher conference at school... -- Amy races into her DAUGHTER’S CLASSROOM...to find clas in session, and all the kids are looking at her like: wha are you doing here? Amy winces, sorry!

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-for Dylan, not Jane... -- Amy races into her SON’S CLASSROOM to again find the c in session. Again, all the kids looks like: why are you h

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-with his math tutor. -- Amy races into an empty room to find the MATH TUTOR waiting, looking at his watch, disapproving. Amy smiles apologetically and wedges herself into a tiny desk...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then, on your way home, you have 56 Phonecalls to return. -- Feverishly talking on her cellphone, Amy aggressively DRIVES her minivan through Boston rush hour traffic...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Also, you wanted me to remind you to go to the grocery store... -- Amy weaves her grocery cart through a CROWDED SUPERMAR still on the phone. She dexterously grabs food-items and flings them into her cart, never slowing down...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then...after all that...  11. -- Amy races her minivan around a corner and pulls into t driveway of her small, cozy, suburban home. She jerks to halt next to her husband’s SEDAN in the driveway...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «..you get to go home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stumbles into her house carrying her work bag and, somehow, ten bags of groceries. She looks exhausted but smiles, happy to see her family...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .»--and you can finally relax. DYLAN sprints past Amy holding a cellphone as JANE chases him, furious, still in her soccer uniform:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN YOU ASSHOLE GIVE ME MY PHONE
dialogues.text: They knock over a lamp and it CRASHES to the ground!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey hey hey--! But the kids race out. Amy SIGHS and lugs all her stuff i

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT ROOM
dialogues.text: to find her husband, MIKE, watching TV with their dog ROS drinking a beer, feet up. He sees Amy and doesn’t get up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh hey babe.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey. Amy crosses to the KITCHEN AREA and puts down her bags, exhausted, as sounds of her kids’ VIOLENT CHASE filter in

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, um, did you notice that Dylan and Jane are kind of like destroying the house?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh no, I’ve been watching Travel Channel! We should totally go to Mongolia by the way--  12.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Because I kind of thought you were watching the kids.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Me? No. I’m really not sure why you thought that... He watches TV as something SHATTERS in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah babe! Amy just looks at her husband looking dopily at her...and decides, for the millionth time, that it just isn’t worth

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nevermind.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Cool -- what’re you making for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy has made a dinner worthy of four Michelin stars: stun filet of fish, three vegetable sides, bottle of crisp whi wine, and a fresh-baked cake on a stand. The family wolfs down the meal in silence. Mike types on his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So. Dylan, how’d you do on your science quiz today?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I got a D.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (troubled) Oh. Wow. Do you need extra help? Or Maybe another tutor?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m good. Frowning, Amy nudges Mike, who’s still reading his iPhone

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did you hear that, honey? Dylan got a Don his science quiz.  13. Mike blindly holds up his hand:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Nice going, bud. They high-five as Mike keeps typing on his phone. Amy jus looks at her husband, frustrated... Then she remembers:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh Jane, how were your soccer tryouts?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh my god mom don’t stress me out any more than I already am!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, I was just--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Coach is posting the list of who made the team at 9 o’clock tonight and I’m so nervous it’s giving me a rash look at my rash! Jane holds up her arm to reveal a RASH. Amy frowns, worri

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh god, baby, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: That looks like lupus.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh my God I have fucking lupus?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, you don’t have lupus, and you’re gonna make the soccer team, okay? I promise. Just don’t go all black swan on me right now, okay? INT. JANE’S ROOM -- LATER THAT NIGHT Jane's bedroom is a shrine to all things soccer. Posters, jerseys, cleats on the floor -- soccer is her life. Insan stressed, Jane and Amy pace in front the laptop on Jane's bed, biting their nails in exactly the same way...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What time is it now?!

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: Mother and daughter pace. Then Amy looks at her watch:
Jane lunges for the laptop and furiously types. She scans screen...and then freaks out:

dialogues.speaker: I MADE IT
dialogues.text: They hug and jump together!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: OH MY GOD I’M SO RELIEVED! They finally stop jumping and catch their breath. Amy bea

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am so proud of you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mom. I never could have done this without you. Amy smiles, touched. These are the moments that make it a worth it...

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God this is gonna look so pimp on my college applications! I mean I’ve got the grades, I’ve got 150 hours of community service, I've got four bullshit extra- curriculars, but playing on a state ranked soccer team?! That’s huge! (grinning, then) Wait... What if I don't play?! What if I'm a benchwarmer?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh baby it’s fine--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No it’s not fine! Do you have any idea how hard it is to get into an Ivy League school now?! They turn away Asians, mom!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, that’s a little racist--  15.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: If I don’t make the starting line- up the recruiters won't see me play and then I'll have to go to a D3 college then I’m gonna go to a crappy law school then my alcoholic boyfriend is going to knock me up and before you know it we’re all living in a school bus on the side of the highway! Oh my god I need to practice my footwork why the hell did I eat dessert?! Jane grabs a SOCCER BALL and hurries out, hyper-stressed. just stands there, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Holy shit she's so crazy. INT. MIKE’S HOME OFFICE -- LATER THAT NIGHT Amy enters Mike’s home office, yawning, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Good news, Jane made the soccer-- Amy stops upon seeing Mike behind his DESKTOP COMPUTER, trying to zip his pants and use the mouse at the same tim

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god are you--?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No! It was just...a prostate thing-- (struggling with mouse) Why won't this window close?! Amy makes her way around the desk, chuckling...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know, I’ve always wondered what kind of porno you like-- Her smile vanishes when she sees that Mike is Skyping wit NAKED WOMAN with giant boobs and an even bigger bush. The naked woman sees Amy enter frame, and looks pissed:

dialogues.speaker: NAKED WOMAN ON COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m his wife -- who are you?!  16.

dialogues.speaker: NAKED WOMAN ON COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Oh shit-- The naked woman lunges out of frame. Amy spins on Mike:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are you masturbating with another woman on Skype?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No! No.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (beat) Okay yes obviously I’m masturbating with another woman on Skype.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why are you doing that?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t think I’ve done anything wrong here. This is very mainstream now. Amy rubs her face, trying to get her head around this...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know Mike. This really feels like cheating...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No no no, this is definitely not cheating. I’ve never even touched her! If anything, this is a sign of how much I respect our marriage.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes! This amazing free app allows me to fulfill all of my darkest desires so I don’t have to bring you into that world. Honestly, I don’t masturbate on Skype for me -- I masturbate on Skype for us.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You gotta be shitting me.  17.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A lot of women would be very happy to find their husbands masturbating on Skype three times a day instead of cheating on them!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You do this three times a day?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: With my work schedule it’s almost impossible, but I try to make time. Honestly, you should try it. It’s very invigorating. Plus it’s totally safe, you can’t get herpes or AIDS--

dialogues.speaker: NAKED WOMAN ON COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Fuck you Mike I don’t have AIDS!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How long have you been doing this?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (looking at screen) 5 minutes and 22 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, like, how many days?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t remember. Not long--

dialogues.speaker: NAKED WOMAN ON COMPUTER
dialogues.text: 10 months next Friday.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Seriously Sharron--?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: 10 months?! Do...Do you love her? The naked woman slowly rises up in the Skype window, curi to hear Mike’s answer. Mike sweats, tense, looking betwee the computer and his wife.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No. I don’t love her. The naked woman on the monitor scowls. So does Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Do you have feelings for her?  18.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, you don’t masturbate with someone for ten months without developing some feelings for them--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Do you have feelings for her, Mike. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes. I have feelings for her. She's actually a pretty amazing woman. She runs her own dairy farm--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of my house Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Can I let my boner go down first--?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! Mike stands, painfully zips up, crosses to the door. Stop

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Are we really doing this?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think we are. Mike nods and exits. Amy just stands there, reeling... On Skype screen the NAKED WOMAN reappears, consoling:

dialogues.speaker: NAKED WOMAN ON COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Look, I just think Mike feels really trapped right now-- Amy clears the entire desk, sending the desktop CRASHING the floor! Then she stands there, trying to breathe... She's about to break down crying when she hears:

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Amy slumps. A mother’s work is literally never done...  19. Amy takes a deep breath, dries her eyes, straightens her shirt, and heads off to help her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m coming sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The early morning sun rises over the picturesque town...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s morning drop-off again. Moms park their minivans and hurry their cute kids off to school...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA DUNKLER
dialogues.text: leans against her car, sporting red fuck-me pumps and way much cleavage. Texting on her phone, she chin-nods at a HOMELY DAD walking by:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Looking good Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Oh, t-thanks--?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You been hitting the speed bag?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Oh, not in like ten years?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Well it’s working buddy-- Just then JEFF’S WIFE grabs his arm and angrily hurries h husband away from Carla. They blow past

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: the desperate stay-at-home mom, who shepherds her four ki towards the school, smiling, barely holding onto her sani

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yay! Another day of school...just like yesterday...and the day before that...and the day before that-- Just then GWENDOLYN, MEAN STACY and VICKY approach, passi out flyers to all the moms:  20.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Emergency PTA meeting tonight at 5! Tell all your friends!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh I don’t really have any friends I'm very isolated at home with the twins--!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: It’s really just a figure of speech-

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I mean sometimes I meet up with other moms in the park but we aren’t really friends we just sit near each other--

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Great! Refreshments will be served! Gwendolyn jams a flyer into Kiki’s hand and hurries off w her crew. Kiki looks at the flyer, deeply touched:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Thank you so much for inviting me! But Gwendolyn and her crew have moved on, handing out fly

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Emergency PTA meeting tonight guys! If you care about your children please come!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- The Hotness is here. They all stop to see JESSIE HARKNESS, 30, coming up the p He is the school’s hot English Teacher, and ALL THE NEARB MOMS subtly, and not so subtly, check him out.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Good morning Mr. Harkness!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Morning, guys!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: I love your tie today!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (looking at his boring tie) Thanks...it’s blue...?  21. The women all EXPLODE LAUGHING way too hard.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh my God he’s so funny!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: He’s like Lewis CK! Jessie smiles, a bit confused, and heads off towards the school. Stacy hungrily eyes his ass as he goes...

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: I would let him put it in my butt. Like in theory I’m against all butt stuff, but I would let him go to town back there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in a white suit, Amy frantically makes a HUGE BREAKFAST of eggs, fresh-squeezed juice, yogurt and grano for her kids. She glances at the clock, stressed...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, listen, Dad had to go out of town so I’m going to try and do everything by myself today! I think I can make it work as long as-- Just their family dog ROSCOE runs headfirst into the kitc wall WHAM! Then he gets up and does it again WHAM! And ag WHAM! The whole family just watches him, troubled...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I think Roscoe is broken.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Come on Roscoe! Not today! EXT. NORCHESTER SCHOOL/AMY’S MINIVAN -- DAY Amy anxiously SPEEDS along while Roscoe sits shotgun wear a BIKE HELMET. The kids sit in the back. Then Amy SQUEALS to school and herds her kids out of the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay I only have four minutes to get Roscoe to the vet so have a great day I love you bye-- Just then TAP-TAP! Gwendolyn raps on Amy’s window. Amy startles and SPILLS coffee all over her white jacket--  22.

dialogues.speaker: GOOD NIGHT THAT IS HOT
dialogues.text: Amy frantically dabs at the spill as she lowers her windo

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hi Gwendolyn!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: (handing her a flyer) Hey babe, there’s an emergency PTA meeting today at 5. Should only last 2-3 hours.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Awesome! Can't wait! Gwendolyn walks off as Amy SQUEALS away, even more stress

dialogues.speaker: FUCK
dialogues.text: (to Roscoe) Please just be okay, buddy-- INT. VETERINARIAN’S EXAM ROOM -- DAY Amy holds Roscoe, listening to her VETERINARIAN:

dialogues.speaker: VETERINARIAN
dialogues.text: Your dog has vertigo.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That can’t be a thing.

dialogues.speaker: VETERINARIAN
dialogues.text: He’s going to vomit and violently shed hair for the next 36 hours.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Is there any medicine he can take?

dialogues.speaker: VETERINARIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. It comes from Brazil and it costs 600 dollars. Amy exhales. This day already sucks and it’s not even 9AM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy runs into the pharmacy -- to see the IMMENSELY LONG L waiting for the pharmacist. She slumps, and gets in line.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy races into work, sweaty and stained and covered in bl dog hair but determined to make this day work. She dodges flying NERF BASKETBALL and runs to the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m here! Amy is here--! Just as she reaches the conference room, the meeting lets out. Super-chill HIPSTERS exit past her.

dialogues.speaker: MONOTONE HIPSTER
dialogues.text: You have shit all over your jacket. Amy peeks inside the conference room to see DALE shaking head at her as he talks to a co-worker. Amy winces, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy sits in the auditorium watching Dylan’s 6th grade cla put on a cute/horrible play. As a kid playing ABRAHAM LIN drones on and on, Dylan just stands there, YAWNING, in wh appears to be a donkey costume. Amy smiles, encouraging, secretly glances at her watch, anxious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy wolfs down lunch from the tupperware on her lap as sh speeds through Boston. When she slams on her brakes to av an accident, her lunch flies all over her already stained white suit! She SCREAMS, no--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy paces in a COFFEE TESTING LAB, talking urgently on he phone. When a MAN IN A WHITE LAB COAT hands her a small tester cup of coffee, Amy shoots it down without thinking and then discovers it’s scalding hot! She explodes COUGHI The Lab Coat Guys just look at her, deadpan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jane and Dylan sit outside of school, waiting to be picke up, annoyed. Frazzled, Amy ROARS up to the school. The va sliding door opens and Amy yells:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know I know I’m sorry I’m late! Jane and Dylan hop into the still-slightly-moving vehicle  24.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MINIVAN
dialogues.text: Jane angrily buckles up as Amy accelerates off.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m going to be late to my first soccer practice!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, baby! I’m trying!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah well try harder! My future is on the line here mom! As Jane starts frantically getting dressed in her soccer clothes, Amy smiles at Dylan in the rear view mirror:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How was your day, Dylan?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I swallowed a pen cap. Amy slumps her head, shit, when--

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: Amy clips a parked car’s side mirror, SHATTERING her own! glances in her rear view mirror...then looks at the dashb clock...then she FLOORS it away from the scene of the cri

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Oh crap was that a hit and run--?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nope! No it was not! But Jane nods at her little brother: it totally was!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-intensity GIRLS’ SOCCER PRACTICE is already underw on this lush green field. Then Amy squeals up and hops ou with Jane, who’s still getting dressed. Amy helps Jane pu on her jersey as Jane hops, trying to put on her left cleat... They hustle towards the soccer practice past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy hurries Jane along:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Go go go--!  25. Jane runs onto the field while Amy hurries over to COACH PATEL on the sidelines, disheveled and deeply apologetic.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, Coach. This is all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: COACH PATEL
dialogues.text: (noticing her look) Rough day?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god, it literally couldn't get any wor--

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: A ball DRILLS Amy in the head and she drops OUT OF FRAME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of MOMS sit on folding chairs in the gymnasium a Gwendolyn takes the podium, wearing a headset mic.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Hi guys. For those of you who don’t know me, I’m Gwendolyn James-- One person APPLAUDS way too aggressively. GWENDOLYN (CONT’D) Can it, Vicky. The applause stops. GWENDOLYN (CONT’D) I'm president of the PTA, I run my own lifestyle blog, Perfectmoms dotcom, and, most importantly, I am the proud mommy of two amazing daughters, Blair and Gandhi.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK OF THE AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: The doors open and AMY slowly enters, looking like a disaster: her hair is frazzled, her left eye is swollen, there is coffee, and food, and god knows what else all ov her once white suit. Onstage, Gwendolyn continues her spe  26.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I called this emergency PTA meeting to address an issue that radically affects the safety of our children: (dramatic beat) The Bake Sale. Amy just stands there, and says to no one in particular:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did she just say...the bake sale?

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY MOM
dialogues.text: I-I think so? Onstage, Gwendolyn clicks through a very polished POWERPO PRESENTATION. It’s like a TED Talk.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Here is a list of toxic ingredients that are banned from the bake sale: no BPA, MSG, BHA, or BHT, plus no sesame or soy and obviously no sugar or nuts or eggs or gluten or milk or butter or salt. In the front row, KIKI tentatively raises her hand, confu

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: So what ingredients can we use--?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: To enforce these rules, I am creating a Bake Sale Police Force who will monitor the food, destroy any offending treats, and punish the wrongdoers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Is this a joke? Did she say this was a joke before I got here? The nearby mom shakes her head, no...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: And the first volunteer for my Bake Sale Police Force is... (looking up, seeing Amy) Amy Mitchell! That’s what you get for being late, sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: W-What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please arrive at the Bake Sale two hours early to get trained... 27. And then something amazing happens. Amy says the one word never says:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. Gwendolyn’s smile wavers, unsure she heard correctly.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: What’s that now?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’ve had a really long day. I’ve been burned, bruised, and knocked unconscious. I screwed up my daughter's first day of soccer and I hand-searched my son’s poo for a pen cap he ate and my dog has vertigo and I have no help at home and I feel completely alone and old and unfuckable and I’m drowning at work and three hours ago I may or may not have committed a felony hit and run. And that was just today. (beat) I can’t do this anymore. I can’t give any more of myself. There’s none of me left. And there’s no way I’m going to be on your fucking Bake Sale Police Force. I’m sorry, I’m done. I quit. All the Moms stare at her, shocked. Amy turns and walks o Gwendolyn just watches her, aghast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy exits the school like a zombie and walks into the nig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy enters this restaurant and sits at the bar, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: What can I get y--?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes. The bartender hurries off to get her a drink...  28.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM NEXT TO HER
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you. Amy looks over to see CARLA DUNKLER sitting next to her i sexy top, drinking a cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You're that chick who always drives my kid home from school when I forget-slash-don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Amy Mitchell.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Carla Dunkler. Jesus, you look like a bag of dicks. The bartender brings Amy a scotch. She downs it.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Would you like a water--?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Leave the bottle. The bartender hesitates, then Carla nods at him, leave it does and moves off, just as:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND AMY
dialogues.text: Amy?! There you are! Amy and Carla turn to see KIKI, the smiley, anxious stay- home mom, hurrying over to them, just so excited!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I’m so so sorry to interrupt you guys, I just wanted to say that what you did in there was amazing! You said everything I’ve ever felt about being a mom but couldn’t say because I’m a total spazz or at least that’s what my husband says he’s a doctor!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, thanks. It’s Kiki, right?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: YES! Oh my God I can’t believe you know my name!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You want to have a drink with us?  29.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh no, I can’t! I have to go to the grocery store then I have to go home and clean my son’s aquarium he gets so mad when I forget--!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Sit down Kiki.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: (sitting) Yes okay I'd love an apple juice!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (pouring Kiki a scotch) Try this instead.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The three moms are still talking and drinking, looser now

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: .--I just feel like we all work way too hard trying to make our kids’ lives amazing and magical and it’s like: they’re kids, their lives already are amazing and magical.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: My daughter thinks sticks are amazing! She’s not very bright.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And its turned into this crazy arms race between moms -- it’s like “oh, you got a clown for your kid's birthday party? I'll get the entire cast of Frozen for mine.”

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, my mom would buy a sheetcake from 7-Eleven for my birthday. That’s it. And it rocked.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! You’d get all jacked up on cake and off-brand soda and you'd run around the park with your friends and it was awesome! We didn’t need Frozen! Fuck Frozen!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: and the women are pretty buzzed.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: ...you know what I hate? There are so many rules now!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Don’t punish your kids!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Don’t say no to your kids!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Go to your kid’s baseball games! Tell your kid you love him every single day! Don’t sleep with the janitor at your kid’s school! What is this, Russia?! Carla drinks, disgusted, as Amy and Kiki exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Those aren’t...all...terrible rules-

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Which janitor did you sleep with?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Rusty.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: The super old one?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I thought he died.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Look bitches, it’s not easy out there for a single mom over the age of 40. I gotta do all the mom shit you guys do plus I gotta look sexy doing it. Not that it matters, because all guys our age want to do is fuck 20 year old girls with bald pussies. That’s it. It’s like, excuse me, are you 20 years old and is your vagina completely devoid of hair? Great let’s get married. But an old chick like me, with alimony and a big bush and a weird kid sleeping upstairs? No way, I’m damaged goods. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I gotta get it wherever I can: old guys, immigrants, the occasional felon.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: (horrified, smiling) You sleep with felons?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, felons are great in bed. They're just so psyched you’re not aman, you know?

dialogues.speaker: EVEN LATER
dialogues.text: Amy stares off, dreamy, as Kiki and Carla listen, buzzed.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know what my biggest mom fantasy is? Having a quiet breakfast...by myself. Kiki and Carla nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s hot.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Sometimes when I’m driving and I’m all alone I fantasize about getting into a car crash. Not like a big car crash with fire and explosions, just like a little one, and then I get to go to the hospital for two weeks and I sleep all day and watch TV and eat jello and it’s all covered by insurance and my family comes and they’re so nice to me and Kent has tears in his eyes and he pretends it’s hay fever but we all know why he’s crying, we all know, and my kids bring balloons and the nurses rub cream on my feet and oh my God it’s so amazing... Kiki notices Amy and Carla looking at her like she’s nuts KIKI (CONT’D) Is that like...something you guys fantasize about too? No?  32.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: The only thing I fantasize about is an old man with a ten inch dick who wants to buy me a car.

dialogues.speaker: EVEN LATER
dialogues.text: and the girls are pretty well sloshed.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: .»..and you know who doesn’t deal with any of this crap? Men.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yup. To be a great dad, all you gotta do is show up to a couple of your kid’s soccer games. That’s it. But if my daughter doesn’t play cello and speak Portuguese and volunteer at the homeless shelter she built by hand from the fucking tree farm she’s growing in our backyard, I’m a bad mom.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Seriously, in this day and age, it’s impossible to be a good mom.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So screw it... (raising her glass) Let’s be bad moms.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh this is so exciting!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: If this is gonna involve a lot of drinking, I’m in. They splashily toast:

dialogues.speaker: TO BAD MOMS
dialogues.text: They drink up. Kiki is plastered:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I love you guys forever.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Dude, we just met--  33.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We love you too, sweetie. Now let’s get you home, okay?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I still need to go to the supermarket... Kiki stands, wobbly. Amy stabilizes her, looks at Carla:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Then let’s go to the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s late and the market is full of exhausted, overworked MOMS. Then the SLIDING DOORS OPEN, 2Chainz kicks in, and

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA ENTER THE SUPERMARKET
dialogues.text: like a fucking hurricane -- slo mo, hair blowing, beats pumping, and, for some reason, Carla is driving one of th electric three-wheel shopping carts. The TIRED MOMS turn to see Amy, Kiki and Carla entering i all their glory...and they’re totally blown away. One of tired moms lips, in dramatic slo mo: “who are these bitch

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA ATTACK THE CEREAL AISLE
dialogues.text: They rip open boxes of cereal and pour them in their mouths...then into each other’s mouths...then they just shower each other -- and passersby -- with cereal! Then

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA RACE PAST AN OLDER EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: restocking the shelves, tired. Then Carla doubles back, FRENCH KISSES the fuck out of him, and races on! Then

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA ATTACK THE LIQUOR AISLE
dialogues.text: Wearing sunglasses with the price tags still on them, Amy Kiki and Carla mix MUDSLIDES by draining milk jugs and ad Kahlua and vodka! Booze and milk splash all over the floo Then, as Amy and Kiki cheer her on, Carla chugs her entir jug! 90% of the fluid splashes onto her face and clothes, she doesn’t care! When she finishes, she drop-kicks the e jug across the store! Amy and Kiki jump up and down YAY!  34.

dialogues.speaker: A SECURITY GUARD STORMS AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: and charges right at them, pissed, in action movie slo-mo Amy and Kiki turn and flee, laughing: oh shit! But Carla frowns and runs right at the security guard like a bull!

dialogues.speaker: THE SECURITY GUARD SEES CARLA RUNNING RIGHT AT HIM
dialogues.text: and he suddenly looks less confident -- umm? -- then he l scared -- who is this chick? -- and then, slipping on the floor, he turns and hightails it away from Carla, terrifi She chases him around the corner, screaming, insane!

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA RUN THROUGH THE AISLES
dialogues.text: high-fiving the tired moms, encouraging them, keep going! can do it! One mom covers her kid’s eyes, don’t look at t crazy women! All the while, 2 Chainz blasts, until--

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA PASS AN ADORABLE BABY IN A STROLLER
dialogues.text: and the deafening hip-hop abruptly stops, and the three m stop to COO at the beautiful baby.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God: so cute.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Adorable.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I want to eat her face. Then 2Chainz kicks in again and the moms race off again!

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA PUSH OVERFLOWING GROCERY CARTS
dialogues.text: towards the exit. They’re filled with junk food, beach chairs, inflatable toys, etc. They descend on the SELF-CHECKOUT MACHINES and start swip their selections. Carla pretends to fuck the face of the machine as the SUPERMARKET MANAGER watches on, frozen in horror. Then, as the 2Chainz song builds to its epic clim

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA EXIT THE SUPERMARKET
dialogues.text: with carts full of ridiculous items. Drinking a Bud Light tallboy, Amy flashes the TIRED MOMS the peace sign, we ou while Kiki dances very whitely in her cart and Carla angr makes the “I’m shooting my wad at you” hand gesture at al the TIRED MOMS in line, who just stare, dumbstruck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan and Jane sit at the empty kitchen table the next morning, dressed and concerned. Jane looks at the wall cl

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Should we just wake Mom up--? Just then, AMY, hungover as fuck, wearing an oversized sweatshirt and giant slippers, shuffles into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Are you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It’s cool. This is just how I look when I’m incredibly hungover... Amy pulls a HOSTESS DING DONG out of a box and starts eat it. Jane watches, worried.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Aren’t you going to make us breakfast? Amy looks at her kids, chewing, considering...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no. I’m not gonna make your meals anymore... Jane and Dylan exchange a horrified look:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: But...what are we gonna eat?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (mouth full) I'd recommend the Ding-Dongs, but you can have whatever you want. (shuffling off) We're leaving in five minutes...or however long it takes me to find my pants. She shuffles off. Jane and Dylan look alarmed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing big sunglasses and frowzy sweats, her hair in a b Amy exits her house with her kids and makes for her miniv Then she notices a COVERED CAR parked in the garage, stop  36.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know what? Screw it. Let’s take daddy's special car today...

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Are...Are we allowed to do that? Amy crosses to the car and yanks off its cover to reveal beautifully restored red 1968 FORD MUSTANG. She smiles:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Momma’s gonna get you to school on time for once.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLASSIC MUSTANG FISHTAILING AROUND A CORNER
dialogues.text: and ROARING through the neighborhood! Amy grins, wind in hair, radio BLASTING ARIANA GRANDE or some other teen pop sensation! Jane sits shotgun, dancing in her seat, while the back, Dylan holds on for dear life, his face peeled b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of YOGA MOMS chat by the curb when Amy ROARS up i the Mustang and SQUEALS to a diagonal stop. The YOGA MOMS look appalled but Amy doesn’t care, smiling at her childr

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Have a great day, kids! Amy kisses her children as they get out of the car...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and don’t forget your lunch! She throws two bags of McDONALD’S out of the car and her catch them, psyched.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thanks mom!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: You're the best mom ever! Dylan and Jane hurry off towards the school as GWENDOLYN her crew appear, eying the bags of McDonald’s with horror Gwendolyn calls over to Amy:  37.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: We're having a PTA meeting to discuss the upcoming election at 2-- will we see you there?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: God I hope not! Amy grins and FLOORS the Mustang off, leaving Gwendolyn a her crew standing there, shocked. Gwendolyn seethes, omin

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: This bitch is playing a dangerous game.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: I like her red car!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy sits at this sunny outdoor cafe, reading a newspaper, happier than we've ever seen her. A WAITER brings her a l cup of coffee, a delicious pastry, and a side of bacon.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god this is so amazing! (to a MOM sitting nearby) This is amazing, right?!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (a bit thrown) Oh. Yes. I suppose it is.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Do people actually live like this?!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Yeah? I mean, I do.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really?! What’s the secret?!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Well, I’m super rich...?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Right! That’1l do it-- Amy's cellphone RINGS. She answers it:  38.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Best morning ever this is Amy!

dialogues.speaker: AMY'S BOSS DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: as he angrily paces in his huge ultra-hip office. TESSA a dozen HIPSTERS sit in a circle on the floor, scared, as D barks into a speakerphone, furious:

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Amy, where are you? The Morning Huddle started an hour ago!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m not gonna go to those anymore. They’re a total waste of time. Several employees stymie LAUGHTER. Dale reddens, embarras

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Are you feeling okay Amy?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Never felt better Dale. I’m eating a quiet breakfast and reading a newspaper for the first time in 12 years, plus I just met a very nice rich lady named-- Amy nods at the nearby mom, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: J-Janet?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (back to phone) --named Janet. And I think we might be best friends.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Listen to me Amy: you need to come into the office right now!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Actually I don’t, Dale. I only work for you three days a week. If you want me to work more, you should pay me to do that instead of preying on my classically female desire to go above and beyond what’s asked of me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, no one is preying on anyone--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Because it would suck for the CEO of a company that markets itself as pro-woman and pro-mom and whose customer base is 68% female to get sued by a working mom for unfair labor practices.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! There’s no need to talk about lawsuits! And just for the record, I am very pro-mom!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Great! Then act like it! (hangs up, smiles at Janet) You gonna finish your scone? 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy strolls down this quaint street lined with cute shops carrying several shopping bags, WHISTLING to herself, hap Then she dials her phone.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: in her house, ironing her husband's dress shirts while he TWINS play at her feet, SCREAMING. She answers,

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Kiki, it’s Amy!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh hey! How are you?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m awesome! Hey, I just saw in the paper that the new Channing Tatum movie where he’s an astronaut but he never wears a shirt is playing at the Century 12, and I wanted to know if you wanted to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Wait...you’re just gonna go to a movie?! In the middle of the day?! stressed:  40.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yal

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Are we, like...allowed to do that?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I think we are! Call a sitter!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh no I couldn’t! Kent would kill me if he ever found out!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How would he find out? Kiki looks around, her heart racing...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, live a little...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Okay okay okay I’m gonna do it!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Great. I’m gonna call Carla.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Fun! I like her but I’m also very scared of her! See you soon! Smiling, Amy hangs up and dials...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: answering her phone, eating a hot dog and talking loudly:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s Amy! Do you want to come to the movies with me and Kiki?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I’m already here. GO WIDE to reveal that Carla is, in fact, watching a movi the theater. Everyone glares at her for talking on her ph

dialogues.speaker: GET OFF YOUR PHONE, LADY
dialogues.text: Carla blindly flips off the entire theater and keeps talk  41.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What do you bitches wanna see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, Kiki and Carla eat popcorn and watch as, onscreen, CHANNING TATUM, wearing a skin-tight astronaut’s outfit a helmet, spacewalks outside of a space shuttle towards a FEMALE ASTRONAUT. Then he rips off his shirt. In outer sp The moms high-five each other, nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moms eat lunch and have drinks at a bistro after the movie, still excited about their newfound freedom.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This has been such a great day. Thanks for coming out with me.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Are you joking?! This has been the best day of my life!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, my ex has my kid for the day so it worked out perfect-- Carla touches the LATIN BUSBOY’s hand as refills their wa

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you sir. Your water service today has been exemplary. The busboy smiles, a bit confused, and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So is it hard sharing your son with your ex-husband?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Fuck no. Have you seen my son? He’s nine feet tall and all he talks about is baseball. You know what’s interesting about baseball?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s a bunch of fat rednecks standing around chewing tobacco in their pajamas. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honestly I wish my son was into collecting feathers -- it’d be way more interesting.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Do you go to all his games?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: His dad does, but I just can’t anymore. The last game of his I went to lasted six hours and the final score was 1 to 2. In the 17th inning I nearly took my own life. I would rather go to Iraq than to another kid’s baseball game.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And how do you think your divorce affected your son? Carla stops, looks at Amy, reading between the lines.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You got problems at home?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? No! No. I just--

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Because when married bitches ask me 900 questions about my divorce it’s usually because they’re thinking about doing it themselves. Amy frowns...then opens up to the girls:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I found out that my husband has been masturbating on Skype with the same woman for ten months.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: What’s Skype?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Did you torch his car? Because you have to torch his car, that’s just standard operating procedure--  43.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, no, it’s actually okay. I thought I'd be devastated when Mike left, but mostly I just feel relieved. And the kids don’t even seem to notice he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Kids are so fucking dumb.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The truth is...our marriage has been over for years. I just had this vision of what a perfect family was supposed to be like, and being divorced didn’t really fit into that, so I didn’t let my marriage end even when it was clearly over, you know? Carla nods, sympathetic...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Wow. I feel really grateful for my marriage now--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: Kiki? The girls turn to see Kiki’s husband KENT, 40's, handsome preppy. Kiki immediately stands up from the table, scared

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh! Hey babe!

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I’m just having lunch with my new friends! This is Carla and this is--

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Who’s watching the kids?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Rosie.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: But isn’t that your job?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa check your privilege, son--!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yes Kent of course it is! Sorry, I’m heading home now. Bye guys... Kiki quickly grabs her purse, throws some cash on the tab and hurries off, anxious and scared... Kent shoots Amy an Carla a look, then heads off after her. EXT. Amy and INT. The

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Ike Turner! Have a good one!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well. That was alarming...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) On the plus side she left way too much money so it looks like we're gonna get fucked up. (to WAITRESS ) Can you send our water server over here as soon as possible thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NORCHESTER SCHOOL
dialogues.text: pulls her Mustang up to the school, parks in a red zone, gets out, eating HOSTESS DONUT HOLES from a box...

dialogues.speaker: NORCHESTER SCHOOL
dialogues.text: BAKE SALE is going on in the main lobby of the school. ANXIOUS MOMS stand behind decorated tables selling their elaborate home-made confections: hand-dipped pastries, origami brittle, personal souffles. Then

dialogues.speaker: AMY DROPS HER HALF-EATEN BOX OF DONUTS ON AN EMPTY TABLE
dialogues.text: and sits, putting her feet up. A KID instantly hurries ov

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Oh my God I love donut holes! How much are they?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks each. The kid looks appalled when--

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: Oh my! What is this?!  45. Amy looks over to see GWENDOLYN and her crew approaching, carrying DAZZLING ORNATE HOMEMADE PASTRIES. Gwendolyn sto her smile thinly masking her horror:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Umm, are those store bought donut holes?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh no, I made them by hand and then I put them in this box.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Oh thank god because we don’t allow store-bought--!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Seriously, Vicky?! Vicky silences, chastened.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Look, Gwendolyn, who cares what kind of food people bring as long as it raises money for the school? Gwendolyn and her friends recoil as if slapped.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Oh no she didn’t...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: I think she just did...

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Give it to her, G. Gwendolyn inhales, her fake smile tighter than ever:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I care what food people bring, Amy, because this school has extremely high standards, and that’s why we have the best test scores in the state, the best college acceptance rate in the state, and yes, the best artisanal bake sales in the state, six years running.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: And I believe -- no, I know -- that excellent schools build excellent children, and that’s what we all want, isn’t it Amy?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I sort of want happy children?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Oh that’s a good point actually--

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Excellent children are happy children because losers are never happy and everyone knows that! Gwendolyn gets right in Amy’s face, at her breaking point GWENDOLYN (CONT’D) Now I don’t know what’s been going on with you lately, with your weird outbursts and your terrible style, but it ends now. I run this school, and I can make life very difficult for you and your underachieving children, do you understand? Amy stands toe-to-toe with Gwendolyn, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Can I be honest? I think you need to chill the fuck out. Here, have a donut hole... (offering the box) Seriously. They’re amazing. They’re made in China-- Gwendolyn SWATS the box and donut holes go flying everywh Then Gwendolyn gets right up in Amy’s face, insane:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: You just crossed the red line little girl -- and now I'm gonna have to get crazy on that ass.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Oh my God you’re so fucked! Amy swallows, scared, as Gwendolyn spins and storms off - SMASHING into a MOM carrying a fragile gingerbread house she goes! The mom, and the gingerbread house, go flying!  47.

dialogues.speaker: BRIE
dialogues.text: (on ground, scared) Sorry Gwendolyn!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. NORCHESTER / INT. AMY’S MUSTANG -- DAY Still rattled by her clash with Gwendolyn, Amy drives Jan through Norchester after school. Jane is stressed as ever

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m so not ready for SAT Bootcamp right now! Did I tell you that there's always a line for the bathroom because everyone is in there throwing up?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Ya! Sydney Green barfs like three times a class. She’s so thin. Amy frowns, troubled, as they pull up to the SAT BOOTCAMP storefront. Several STRESSED-OUT TEENAGERS pace out front

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wait...why are we even doing this?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Umm so I can dominate the SATs and get into a sick college and have an awesome life? Suddenly Amy starts accelerating. Jane looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wh--? You’re passing SAT Bootcamp! Why are you passing SAT Bootcamp?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Fuck SAT Bootcamp.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We're playing hooky.  48.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: But I need to learn this stuff!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The only thing you need to learn how to do is relax. And I know just where to take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane pull up to a lush, super-expensive DAY SPA. VALET whisks away Porsche’s and BMWs. Jane’s eyes are wid

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Mom! We can’t afford this place!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know. Just be cool. Smiling, confident, Amy gets out and lobs her keys to the VALET, acting very much like she belongs.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Keep her close. Amy and Jane make their way towards the spa entrance...th at the last second, Amy ducks AROUND THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING, and Jane hurries after her!

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are we going--?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Shhh! Amy and Jane sneak along the back of the building until t reach a WINDOWLESS DOOR. Amy knocks twice. A beat. Then C opens the door, dressed in her white spa uniform, smiling

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What up bitches?! Carla looks around, then waves them inside, hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla guides Amy and Jane through the ultra-lux spa...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Thanks again for doing this!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah this is so cool!  49.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: No worries. You have full access to everything in the spa. Have fun-- Carla unlocks the LOCKER ROOM DOOR and they scramble insi

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just don’t pee in the hot tub because I’m gonna use it later-- Carla hurries off. Amy and Jane look around at the beautifully appointed locker room, then hug each other an jump up and down, conspiratorial and excited!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: This is so much better that SAT Bootcamp!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know! What do you want to do first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane lie in side-by-side MUD BATHS, relaxing.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god this is so nice...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: How many people do you think have shat in here? A beat. Then mother and daughter laugh together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane lie on wood tables as TOUGH OLD KOREAN WOMEN panties and bras walk on their backs, supporting themselv by ropes running along the ceiling. Wincing with every step, Jane whispers over to her mom:

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Why are...these chicks...in their underwear?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don't...know but...it feels... really good.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane get facials, side-by-side. Their faces are covered in thick white cream.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You look like a Juggalo.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You look like Anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane recline in a zen garden wearing PLUSH WHITE ROBES while a MONK plays soothing FLUTE MUSIC in the corn Amy and Jane inhale deeply, completely relaxed...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m really glad we did this, mom. I haven't felt this chill in, like, forever.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh I’m so glad, baby. You need a break from SATs and school and soccer and the whole dad thing and--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Wait, what whole dad thing?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nothing! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Does Dad have a brain tumor?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? No! It’s just...your father and I are going through a bit of a rough patch right now.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Holy shit you’re getting divorced?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! No. We’re...probably...not getting divorced...right away.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you're telling me this life-changing information in a rock garden while some weird monk plays the flute! What is the matter with you?!  51.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jane, listen. No matter what happens with your father and me, I need you to know: it’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Why the hell would it be my fault?! Why would you even say that?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, I’m so not good at this--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m going to be from a broken home! What are we going to do at Christmas?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Baby, Christmas is in like 8 months-—

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Wait: am I going to be a whore?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Debby Tiner’s parents got divorced and now she gives handjobs to anyone who asks for one!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t think that has anything to do with her parents’ divorce.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No mom, that’s what happens! For the rest of my life I’m going to struggle with intimacy, and I’m going to search for approval from weird old men, and the odds of me getting divorced just went up like a thousand percent! Thanks, mom!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Baby, please--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I just don’t want to be weird okay?! Tears start down Jane’s cheek. Amy puts her arm around Ja comforting, her heart breaking for her daughter...  52.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Sweetie, no matter what the future brings, I love you, and your dad loves you, and you will be okay. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Because I’m your mom and I know you better than anyone in the world. Jane frowns, comforted, sniffling back tears...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I just had my whole life worked out so perfectly and now it’s...not perfect anymore.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know. I did too. But maybe life is supposed to be messy, you know? And maybe trying to make it perfect is what messes everything up in the first place... Jane nods, dries her eyes, feeling a little better...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does Debbie Tiner really give everyone handjobs?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She’s really popular now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a bag of soccer balls, COACH PATEL walks off the field when GWENDOLYN chases him down:

dialogues.speaker: COACH PATEL
dialogues.text: (seeing her) Fuck. (smiling, friendly) Hey Gwendolyn! She reaches him, carrying TWO STARBUCKS BEVERAGES.  53.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I brought your fave -- macchiados!

dialogues.speaker: COACH PATEL
dialogues.text: Oh thanks...?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I wanted to chat about the starting line-up for next week’s game. In particular I wanted to talk about Amy Mitchell's daughter, Jane...

dialogues.speaker: COACH PATEL
dialogues.text: Okay, but you know I can’t really discuss that with you--

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Don’t fuck with me Deepak that’s what the last coach did and now he’s coaching tee-ball in Canada. Coach Patel swallows hard, suddenly scared...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AMY’S HOUSE -- NIGHT Amy and Jane return home, happy and relaxed from the spa.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Thanks again mom. That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m so glad you liked it, baby. Jane crosses to the stairs, stops.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: So wait -- does this mean you're going to start dating dudes?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh. I don’t know. I hadn’t really thought about it... But then she just did.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: I want to get laid.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla sits in the hot tub, on her phone with Amy. She nod

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I’m on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla roots through Amy’s closet while Amy paces in her bedroom, drinking a glass of wine, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is so scary! I haven’t even thought about being with another man in like 20 years! Just then Kiki bustles in, excited.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late I had to tell my husband I was going to a night gynecologist!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (flipping through clothes) Dude, what are you gonna wear?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking...my sexy purple dress. Amy pulls A VERY DRAB PURPLE LANE BRYANT MOM DRESS out of closet and holds it up to her body, hopeful...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI CARLA
dialogues.text: I love it! No.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You look like you're going to Grimmace’s funeral. Frowning, Amy hangs up the dress and flips through her closet. She pulls out a huge wool sweater/dress.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh! I like this one.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Me too! It looks very warm!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (repulsed) Is it a dress? Or a sweater?  55.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It’s a dretter! They were huge like five years ago!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Were they, though? A little desperate, Amy pulls out a BLACK FLOOR-LENGTH GO

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you, Jackie Onassis? Amy flips through her clothes, flustered:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m a mom, I don’t have any sexy clothes!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Goddammit get me a pair of scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Amy watches, horrified...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: All right, take off your shirt, I need to see what I’m working with. Amy hesitates, then pulls off her shirt to reveal she’s wearing a GIANT TAN BRA. Carla startles:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit look at your mom bra! It has so much surface area!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: It looks like two tan mixing bowls taped together.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You could make three regular bras out of that one mom bra!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This isn’t a mom bra! This is my sexy bra!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (smiling, then) Oh shit you’re serious. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kiki: go to her daughter’s room and steal her sexy bra, okay?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh no, my daughter doesn’t have a sexy bra, she’s only 16. (thinking about it) Look behind her dresser. Kiki races out--

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CARLA BLOWING OUT AMY’S HAIR to a sizeable coif...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA WAX-STRIPS AMY'S MUSTACHE AREA
dialogues.text: as Kiki irons Amy’s dress...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA STRUGGLES TO ZIP AMY INTO HER DRESS
dialogues.text: as Kiki slides earrings into Amy’s ears... Finally

dialogues.speaker: AMY STEPS IN FRONT OF HER FULL-LENGTH MIRROR
dialogues.text: .+-and she looks super fucking hot. Kiki and Carla appear either side of her and nod, impressed:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
