dialogues.text: You look like Elsa! Amy smiles at her reflection -- it’s been a long, long ti since she’s felt this sexy...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Someone call a motherfucking Uber.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE THREE MOMS EXITING AMY’S HOUSE in SEXY SLOW MOTION, dressed to murder. Jay-Z BLASTS as t moms strut down Amy’s suburban front walk like it was a fashion runway in Paris... On the sidewalk, TWO BOYS ON BIKES stop short and gape at hot moms coming down the path. Still in slo-mo, Amy nods the kids, whatup. The kids nod back, whatup to you.  57. Then Amy passes in front of her SUPER DORKY UBER DRIVER, who’s holding open the back door of his HONDA CIVIC, and slides inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shots of downtown Boston at night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hillstone is a sexy, high-end Boston hotspot. Amy, Kiki, Carla enter. Amy looks nervous...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: This is one of my favorite stomping grounds.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Because it’s really fucking dark. The girls take a seat AT THE BAR. Amy glances at the menu

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey, check out this typo: it says the drinks cost 25 dollars each!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Hilarious I love typos!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: That's how much drinks cost now you fucking hicks. Amy and Kiki exchange a shocked look. Carla scans the cro

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay let’s get to it: what kind of guys do you like?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know! I’ve only been with Mike and like three other guys... (spotting a HOT LATIN GUY) Oo, what about a Latin guy?! I’ve never been with a Latin guy before!  58.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa why don’t you start with a nice pudgy Jewish guy and work your way up to Latin dudes, okay--?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: Excuse me, is this seat taken? The girls all turn to see a HANDSOME MAN IN A SUIT smilin Amy. Amy stammers, suddenly overcome with nerves:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! No! Sit. Please. Here. As the man sits next to Amy, she hisses over to her frien

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god what do I do?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Just laugh at his jokes and agree with all the stupid shit he says-- Amy turns back to the man, smiling, trying to be cool:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m Amy, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: (shaking her hand) Braden. I like your wedding ring. Carla face-palms. Amy blushes, stammering:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, no-- I’m not-- I just found this ring on the subway!

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: And then you decided to wear it?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes. Because...it makes me feel like a...princess...?

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN THE SUIT
dialogues.text: (weirded out) Yeah I think I’m gonna sit somewhere else. The man hurries off. Amy GROANS, full of self-loathing. K leans over, smiling, ever-positive:  59.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: You did great, sweetie, but maybe next time you should try it without your wedding ring on--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yup, it’s already off. The CUTE BARTENDER approaches, friendly, throws down napk

dialogues.speaker: CUTE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Hey ladies, where you in from?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, we live out in Norchester with our kids! The bartender’s attention instantly cools:

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Great what can I get you. As Kiki orders, Carla turns to Amy:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Also maybe don’t mention that we have children--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yup. That was my bad. We start CUTTING QUICKLY to Amy crashing and burning with various guys around the bar: -- Amy talks to a HIP MUSIC GUY:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love music too! Have you heard the new Ariana Grande CD?! -- Amy talks to a VERY YOUNG-LOOKING GUY:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seriously, does your mom know you're here? -- Amy smiles at a SUPER-HIPSTER with pink-framed glasses

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you wearing a costume? -- Amy dabs a stain on some GUY’s shirt with a SHOUT WIPE  60.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This’ll just keep the stain from setting... The man quickly pretends to see a friend and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: Amy sits down with Kiki and Carla, defeated and depressed

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Guys, I suck at this.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: No you don’t. What about Donnie Wahlberg over there? Carla nods at a guy who looks kind of like DONNIE WAHLBER

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh my god is that actually Donnie Wahlberg or is it just a guy who looks kinda like Donnie Wahlberg?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What’s the difference?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Look, I think I just want to go home. The girls nod, sympathetic, and collect their purses... T a GROUP OF GUYS walk past, and one of them recognizes Amy

dialogues.speaker: PASSING MAN
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mitchell? Amy looks up to see JESSIE HARKNESS, the way-too-attracti English teacher at Norchester who we met in first act.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Mr. Harkness?! Instant sparks between the two of them...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Please, call me Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And I'm Amy. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing here?  61.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh, we’re having a girls night out.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Nice. So Mr. Mitchell had to stay home with the kids?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, um, Mr. Mitchell is no longer...on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: She caught him jerking off on Skype-

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s great thank you Carla.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I’m so sorry... (to his FRIENDS) You guys go ahead without me. Jessie sits down next to Amy, concerned...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you doing okay? He touches her arm. It’s electric. Amy swallows.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm, you know, I’m suddenly doing a lot better? Jessie smiles, warm. Amy smiles back. Kiki just watches o grinning, wide-eyed, weird, until Carla pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Okay creepy let’s give them some space. Come on. Carla leads Kiki off through the bar...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Amy is talking to Mr. Harkness! I named my vibrator after him--!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Can you not walk so close to me? I’m still trying to get laid.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Sure thing you got it!  62.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON AMY AND JESSIE
dialogues.text: They talk by candlelight, close, intimate, connecting...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I love teaching English. Books allow kids to talk about what they’re really feeling but are too embarrassed to say, you know? (off Amy’s dreamy gaze) Oh no am I the guy in the bar who won’t stop talking about his job?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No! No. I love how passionate you are about what you do...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You work at Coffee For The People, right?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I might've asked around about you a little bit...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?! No way! You asked about me?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Yeah! I’ve always had a thing for you, you know that... Amy stammers, blown away...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Actually...I did not know that...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Really? I always felt like I made it way too obvious... A beat. Then Amy lunges and KISSES him--

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God! He quickly pulls away. Amy is mortified:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry! I haven't done this in a really long time!  63.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No it was great, you just scared the shit out of me! She laughs, embarrassed... Then he cradles her face gentl and kisses her properly...

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY
dialogues.text: Carla flirts with Donnie Wahlberg-- until Kiki spasticall hits her, look look look! Carla turns to see Amy kissing Jessie, and smiles, nice. Then Kiki raises her phone to t a photo of them, and Carla slaps her hand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises. Birds chirp. Love is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy wakes up in her bed, still glowing from the night bef Her phone RINGS with a text. She quickly grabs it, reads: TEXT FROM JESSIE: “Nice seeing you last night Mrs. Mitche Amy grins and TEXTS back: “The pleasure was all mine Mr. Harkness.” Amy holds the phone close, and smiles up at the ceiling..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy bounds down the stairs, breezes into the kitchen...an SCREAMS! Sitting, eating cereal, reading US Weekly, is MI

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What up babe.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What--?! What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I want to get back together. I never should have left you, that was a total dick move.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Three days ago you told me you had feelings for another woman.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I know but then I met her in person and she’s super weird.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So that’s why you want to get back together with me?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No! That’s not the only reason... (thinking) I also miss Jane and Dylan. Mostly Dylan, but I miss Jane too. Mike searches for forgiveness, but Amy isn’t buying it...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look I just needed a break. Haven't you ever just needed a break?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Of course I have, but I didn’t blow up my family to do it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mark Feinstein facetimed with a hooker and his wife took him back.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a fuck about Mark Feinstein.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, here’s the deal: I love our kids and I'm willing to do whatever it takes to fix our marriage.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You’d even go to therapy?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No way therapy is dumb! Amy starts physically shooing Mike towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Great, thanks for stopping by.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on Aim, don’t be a dick! I’m trying to do the right thing here-- They reach the door, and Mike stops, panicked:  65.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay okay! Even though it’s a total waste of time and money...and a little gay...I will go to therapy. Amy looks at him, highly skeptical...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And you really gotta get into it too. Like you gotta feel stuff and cry and talk about your fucked up family and the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Babe I haven't cried since the Sox traded Nomar in ‘04.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (shoving him out) Great, have fun on Skype--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay okay I’1l1 cry! I’1l cry the whole fucking time! Jesus! Maybe while we're at therapy we can also talk about how you’re a little crazy sometimes--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So are we doing therapy or what?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’1l think about it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Can I get my US Weekly back because I was in the middle of an article about Khloe Kardashian-- Amy SLAMS the door on his face and stares off, conflicted

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy strolls through a hallway near the gym. FEMALE SOCCER PLAYERS hustle to and fro... Then Amy sees Jane, in her uniform and cleats, sitting on a bench outside Coach Pate office, CRYING. Amy races over, concerned:  66.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh no baby what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Coach just told me I’m not starting! I’m a benchwarmer!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?! But you’re the best forward on the team!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Oh my God my life is ruined I’m never going to college I might as well just become a prostitute!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay okay, settle down. Momma’s gonna fix this, okay? Jane nods, trying to pull herself together...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Okay but please don’t make a scene.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Of course not, baby. Amy looks at her daughter reassuringly, then turns and ki open COACH'S OFFICE DOOR! Inside COACH PATEL spins, sees and how pissed she is, and blurts out, terrified:

dialogues.speaker: COACH PATEL
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn made me!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN HOSTING A P.T.A. TEA IN THE LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn sits with a group of PROPER MOMS in the library wearing fancy hats and drinking tea out of tea cups...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: .+-my goal is to make this year’s PTA luncheon the greatest luncheon this school has ever seen. One of the MOMS LAUGHS, assuming she’s joking. Gwendolyn shoots her an icy look. The Mom silences, shrinks. Just then AMY blows in, furious:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How dare you bench my daughter!  67. The proper moms startle and turn to see Amy, her eyes afi

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh hello, Amy. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You had no right to do that!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Actually I did. Soccer is a PTA sponsored activity, and I’m the president of the PTA, so... This is clearly news to Amy... She stammers, floundering:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay...well...you know... (then, getting an idea) Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh dear, what does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It means I’m gonna run against you for PTA president!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: You can’t be serious...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm sick of you running this school like a dictator! It sucks!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, ladies, Amy's husband recently left her and she’s going through a bit of a mental breakdown right now. Amy GASPS, shocked... The MOMS recoil, embarrassed for he Amy points at Gwendolyn, her blood boiling:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm coming for you Gwendolyn!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Okey doke! Amy storms out. Gwendolyn smiles, completely unworried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy paces in her living room, still amped up, as Kiki and Carla counsel her.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: There is no way you can beat her! Gwendolyn has been PTA president for the last six years!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, but she messed with my kid, and I can’t let that stand.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Right, but Gwendolyn controls all the voting blocs. She’s got The Attachment Moms, The Tiger Moms, The Sad Moms, The Drunk Moms, The Divorced Moms, The Black Moms, The Lesbian Moms -- she even has the Divorced Black Lesbian Moms, and that is not an easy group to win over. Amy frowns, starting to realize just how impossible this going to be... KIKI (CONT’D) Plus if you lose Gwendolyn will destroy you. She’1l put your kids in all the dumb classes and give them all the crappy teachers and forget about soccer -- your kids won’t even get milk!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: But isn’t that exactly why we need to take her down? She’s a bully, and she wants to turn us all into perfect little Nazi moms just like her and she wants all our kids to be hyper-stressed over-scheduled freaks and I don’t want that! My daughter has a new rash every week and she’s only 16! We gotta fight back against these perfect moms!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You had me at Nazi -- let’s punch this chick right in the tits. Amy looks over at Kiki, hopeful...  69.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I still think it’s a really bad idea with long-term ramifications for your children but okay let’s do it I’m totally in!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay! Let’s get started!

dialogues.speaker: AMY XEROXING THOUSANDS OF CAMPAIGN FLYERS AT WORK
dialogues.text: as she looks over her shoulder for her boss coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, Kiki, and Carla enthusiastically hand out campaign flyers to MOMS picking up their kids for the day... Amy staples a flyer to the SCHOOL KIOSK that reads “AMY F PTA PRESIDENT! COME MEET THE CANDIDATE TOMORROW NIGHT!” Kiki slides flyers under car windshield wipers... Carla tries to hand flyers to a group of MOMS walking pas only they refuse them. Carla chases after them, yelling a them to take the damn flyers. The moms literally jog away GWENDOLYN removes one of Amy’s flyers from the windshield her Range Rover. She reads it and smirks, smug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished with flyering, Amy, Kiki and Carla eat dinner in this casual family restaurant while all their KIDS eat at next table over. The moms are in a great mood:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: So how many moms do you think are gonna come to your Meet The Candidate Night?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I told all the moms that if they didn’t come I would fuck their husbands so hopefully we’ll have decent numbers. Amy laughs...then notices her daughter studying a textboo stressed, over at the kids’ table. Amy frowns, concerned:  70.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jesus that kid never stops studying...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: You're lucky. All my kid does with books is try to rip them in half.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m trying so hard to get her to chill out and take life less seriously, and sometimes I feel like I’m doing an okay job, but then like two seconds later I feel like I’m failing miserably. I just wish I knew how I was doing, you know?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yeah, the most frustrating part of being a mom is you have no idea if you're doing a good job or not until your kids are fully grown.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, and then it’s too late. They're either cool or they’re meth head serial killers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The worst part is Jane is exactly like me -- she wants everything to be perfect and of course all that does is drive you completely insane. Luckily Dylan turned out like his dad and he’s lazy as shit. The moms look over at their kids...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yesterday I gave Bernard the wrong juice box and he called me a cunt.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: My son still watches Sesame Street.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: My daughter stole money from a homeless woman.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I have no idea who Jaxon’s dad is.  71.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: My son failed Study Hall. The school said no one has ever done that before.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Clare killed our neighbor’s ferret and we all pretended it was an accident but it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I don’t like my kid.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: One time I left Bernard at the mall on purpose. The moms frown at their kids, troubled...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: But fuck I love them so much.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Me too I would literally die for them right now.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Every time I think about that big dumb motherfucker going off to college I cry like a baby... Carla looks at her giant son, growing emotional.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Damn you’re gonna make me cry too.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: (pouring tears) I’m already going! Look at me! Children are such a gift! OVER AT THE KIDS’ TABLE The kids glance over and see their moms all crying togeth

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: What are they crying about now?

dialogues.speaker: BERNARD
dialogues.text: Who cares. They’re so weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another sunrise over Amy's house... INT. AMY’S KITCHEN -- MORNING Amy brews coffee while Dylan grumpily makes himself a bow cereal for breakfast next to her. Milk splashes all over.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Cooking is hard.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, right?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Hey, so where’s my science project?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh. I didn’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: What?! But it’s due today!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, from now on you’re actually gonna have to do your own homework.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: WHAT?! That’s so unfair!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh boy--

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I’m a slow learner, remember?! I need help!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're not a slow learner, sweetie, you're just really entitled. Do you know what entitled means?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: No! Because I'm a slow learner!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It means mommy and daddy have been spoiling you and now you think the world owes you something, but it doesn’t. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if you don’t learn how to work hard now, you’re gonna grow up to be just another entitled white dude who thinks he’s awesome for no reason and you’ll start a ska band and it’ll be so terrible and you’1l be mean to girls and you’1ll grow an ironic mustache to look interesting but you won’t actually be interesting and I really don’t want to be responsible for putting that kind of poison into the world, so just do your homework, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Fine. Jesus. Dylan heads off with his cereal, totally eviscerated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee for the People is as casual as ever. Young hipster play ping pong, ride scooters, and drink coffee. A DJ spi Amy enters, smiling, and strolls over to Tessa’s desk...

dialogues.speaker: TESSA
dialogues.text: Hey man, Dale was asking about your hotel project. He seemed really miffed. Do you want to work on that this morning?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nah. I think I’m gonna work as hard as everyone else today... Amy walks right past Tessa to the NEAREST PING PONG TABLE where TWO HIPSTER DUDES are playing:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got next.

dialogues.speaker: AMY KICKING ASS IN PING PONG
dialogues.text: She dominates the hipsters, smashing impossible shot afte impossible shot! CO-WORKERS gather around, impressed. Amy high-fives one of them after hitting a great shot! WOOO!  74.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my God this is so fun! Why didn’t I play with you guys before?!

dialogues.speaker: PING PONG HIPSTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. You’re surprisingly good for your age.

dialogues.speaker: PING PONG HIPSTER
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna come to karaoke lunch with us?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m gonna eat a yogurt at my desk and work on my hotel accounts. The ping pong guys nod, not surprised...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m just fucking with you! Let’s go make some music! They all LAUGH and exit. Tessa watches Amy go, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy ties BALLOONS onto a sign mounted next to her front d reading “MEET THE CANDIDATE NIGHT, COME ON IN!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Kiki set up a very casual wine & pizza party whil Carla reclines on the couch reading a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Where are your kids tonight?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Staying with my very old neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Is he hot?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE AT THE OPEN DOOR
dialogues.text: Knock knock? Amy looks over to see a LESBIAN COUPLE standing in the op front doorway. Amy crosses, welcoming them:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hi guys, come in, come in!  75. The women enter.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry no one’s here yet.

dialogues.speaker: LESBIAN MOM
dialogues.text: Yeah we figured, what with Gwendolyn’s party and all...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: LESBIAN MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, you didn’t know? Gwendolyn heard you were having a campaign party so she threw a competing party at her house. Amy, Kiki, Carla exchange a shocked look.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: That fucking whore!

dialogues.speaker: LESBIAN MOM
dialogues.text: Yeah -- and she has Wolfgang Puck.

dialogues.speaker: WOLFGANG PUCK SLICING PRIME RIB AT A BUFFET
dialogues.text: in Gwendolyn’s beautiful mansion. The buffet is stocked w every food imaginable, and the house is packed with MOMS, eating and whispering about how delicious everything is.. Then GWENDOLYN breezes in like the belle of the ball in s ludicrous dress, smiling and greeting people as she passe

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Wolf the crab is divine! The program will start in five minutes ladies! In the meantime please enjoy Koko Malumbo and the Nigerian Boys Choir! Gwendolyn smiles at an AFRICAN CHILDREN’S CHOIR in the co as they launch into a cover of “Teach Your Children.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, Carla, Kiki and the Lesbian Moms sit on the floor of Amy's living room, eating pizza and drinking wine, depres  76.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Gwendolyn would do this...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, sweetie...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I know a guy who’ll burn her house down if that’s a call you want me to make. Amy just frowns at all the CASES OF CHEAP WINE in the cor

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do with all this wine...?

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. GWENDOLYN’S MANSION -- NIGHT The MOMS sit in rows of chairs in Gwendolyn’s huge living room, listening to her give a speech into a headset mic:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: ...raising children capable of competing in the global marketplace isn’t just an economic issue, it’s a matter of national security. To discuss this issue further, I'd like to welcome the Former Head of CENTCOM, General David Petraeus. IMPRESSED APPLAUSE as DAVID PETRAEUS makes his way to the front of the room. Gwendolyn takes a seat next to a MOM..

dialogues.speaker: THIRSTY MOM
dialogues.text: So sorry to bother you, Gwendolyn, but where's your bar?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: That's really not what tonight is about, Cara. Gwendolyn smiles tartly. The mom frowns. Then she covertl pulls out her phone and texts: DOES AMY HAVE BOOZE?

dialogues.speaker: AMY CHUGGING A GLASS OF WINE
dialogues.text: and then HIGH-FIVING the Lesbian Mom next to her! The mom are sitting on the floor, buzzed, playing that drinking g where you hold your iPhone to your forehead. Everyone is laughing and yelling and having a blast:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why do I have to drink again?!

dialogues.speaker: LESBIAN MOM
dialogues.text: Because you said the clue word!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What--?! I don’t understand how this game works! Fuck! Laughing, Amy drinks more wine as the moms keep playing.

dialogues.speaker: THIRSTY MOM
dialogues.text: Hello--? The moms all turn to see the THIRSTY MOM entering Amy’s house. The second she sees the game they’re playing, she chucks her purse aside and charges inside, psyched: THIRSTY MOM (CONT’D) Oh hell yes!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GWENDOLYN’S MANSION -- NIGHT Petraeus sits as Gwendolyn stands, addressing the MOMS:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Thank you General Petraeus. Now for the next 45 minutes I would like to talk to you about the advantages of year-round school... A BORED MOM in the audience gets a TEXT on her phone. She opens it-- and startles to see it’s a SELFIE OF THE THIRS MOM drunkenly flipping them the bird while Amy, Kiki, Car and the lesbian moms don gangsta poses all around her! It looks crazy fun! The text reads: COME TO AMY’S U BITCHES! Wide-eyed, the mom looks around and sees that ALL THE MOM GWENDOLYN’S HOUSE are getting the same text -- and smilin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LINE OF MOMS STREAMING INTO AMY’S HOUSE! Old school hip hop plays and A FEW MOMS dance with each o in Amy’s living room, happy and free! Amy circulates with bottles of wine, pouring drinks for everyone who wants on DRUNK MOM grabs Amy, looks her in the eye:

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MOM
dialogues.text: This is the best PTA meeting ever!

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. GWENDOLYN’S MANSION -- NIGHT Gwendolyn watches the last MOMS hurry out of her mansion.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: You sure you can’t stay?

dialogues.speaker: DEPARTING MOM
dialogues.text: Sorry I only have my sitter til 9! The moms race out, leaving Gwendolyn’s giant house empty for VICKY and MEAN STACY. Gwendolyn frowns, disturbed...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Well. That ended a lot earlier than I expected...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: You don’t think...they’re all going to Amy’s party, do you?

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Don’t be fucking stupid Vicky, we had Wolfgang Puck and David Petraeus, what does she have? An awkward silence. MEAN STACY (CONT’D) GWENDOLYN We should go. I’ll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn, Mean Stacy and Vicky drive through Norchester night, tense, looking for Amy’s street...

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: I’m sure her party is super-lame. Amy is so poor. They turn down Amy’s street...and their jaws drop:  79.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Amy's party is going off! MINIVANS clog both sides of the street as MOMS eagerly stream into Amy’s house! BASS THUM as MOMS drink and laugh on Amy’s front porch. One MOM alr lies face down on Amy’s front lawn, passed out. Gwendolyn, Stacy, and Vicky stare in disbelief... Then:

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That looks awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of moms down shots then slam down their glasses do on the dining room table! Carla yells at them: ANOTHER!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The entire room is now packed with MOMS dancing like wome who haven’t cut loose in years -- wild, reckless, alive! TIGER MOMS dance with ATTACHMENT MOMS dance with WAY TOO JEWISH MOMS dance with GAY DADS dance with WORKOUT MOMS..

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: KIKI AND ANOTHER MOM show adorable pictures of their kids each other on their phones -- until Carla blows past, SWA their phones to the floor, and charges onward, insane!

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE MOM BREAKDANCES
dialogues.text: as everyone CLAPS and CHEERS her on! She spins around and around and even tries to helicopter on her head... IN AMY’S BEDROOM A WEIRD MOM garishly paints her face with Amy’s make-up..

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Carla makes out with ONE OF THE LESBIAN MOMS, then turns makes out with the OTHER LESBIAN MOM...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: A MOM shows KIKI how to do whippets out of a Cool Whip ca

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK YARD
dialogues.text: THREE MOMS drunkenly do double-dutch while ANOTHER MOM st on a dirt-bike, expertly bouncing on one wheel, while nea WOLFGANG PUCK smokes a joint with TWO HIPPY MOMS, laughin  80.

dialogues.speaker: IN AMY'S LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Amy dances with the mob of women, having a blast, until t song finally ends. Then CARLA stands on Amy's coffee tabl

dialogues.speaker: CANDIDATE AMY...FUCKING...MITCHELL
dialogues.text: The moms APPLAUD as Amy climbs up onto her coffee table. of view, GWENDOLYN, MEAN STACY, and VICKY quietly slip in the back of the room and listen...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey guys, thanks for coming out! I don't have a speech or anything, I just wanted to say that I think we all do way too much stuff, and if I'm elected we’re gonna start doing way less! Less PTA meetings, less bake sales, less luncheons, less bullshit! The moms ROAR their approval! In the back, Gwendolyn look genuinely surprised by the moms’ fury...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our kids need a break too! School starts way too early! And why do they have six hours of homework a night?! Our kids have no time to be kids anymore! And do they really need to take five standardized tests a week?! We shouldn’t be teaching our kids to be good test takers we should be teaching them to be good people! Even MORE RABID APPLAUSE. Gwendolyn rolls her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit if our kids don’t go to Harvard?! My boss went to Harvard and he’s a total douche! The crowd CHEERS as Gwendolyn looks horrified...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Also I think we should all stop doing Zumba! There’s no science supporting it plus you look super embarrassing when you do it!  81. The crowd hesitates a bit, not...totally...behind her...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay I could be wrong about Zumba, but I think I’m right about the other stuff! So if you're tired of being overworked and under- appreciated and if you’re tired of your school making you feel like shit while slowly driving your kids insane or if you’re just a mom who wants to do less, then vote for me! THE CROWD GOES NUTS! Smiling, Amy steps down from the cof table as MOMS swarm her, hugging her, high-fiving her, ta photos with her like she’s famous! Some are even crying:

dialogues.speaker: CRYING MOM
dialogues.text: I love you so much Amy Mitchell!

dialogues.speaker: INSANE MOM
dialogues.text: Can we have a playdate?! I want a playdate with you so fucking bad!

dialogues.speaker: INTENSE MOM
dialogues.text: I will do whatever you tell me to.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn, Stacy and Vicky stare in disbelief:

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: This basic bitch is going to win the election...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: No she’s not -- because I’m gonna hit her where it counts.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: You're going to punch her in the vagina?!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: I literally don’t even know why we hang out with you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Because our kids play lacrosse-- But Gwendolyn is gone. Stacy and Vicky hurry out after he  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is over -- and Amy’s house is decimated. Bottle cups, and trash are everywhere. Amy, Kiki and Carla sit o the kitchen counter, eating cookie dough from a tube, hap

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know the best thing about a mom party? Everyone leaves at 11:00.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I made out with a lot of women tonight.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I really like whippets--! MAN’S VOICE IN HALLWAY (0.S.) Hello? Amy looks at her friends, confused. Then JESSIE appears i the kitchen doorway, ruggedly handsome -- and a bit confu Amy straightens, surprised:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh hey! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Umm, you kind of...booty-texted me?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?! Carla hops off the counter and grabs Kiki--

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Great party Aim we’ll see ya later. Carla and Kiki hurry out. Amy smiles, understanding...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I think Carla booty- texted you with my phone.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Thank god, because what she wrote was deeply disturbing. Amy laughs. Then there’s an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So should I...like...go? Amy looks at him...considers...  83.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. You really shouldn't. A beat. Then they start making out like crazy, driving ea other around the kitchen, upsetting glasses, bowls, plate With his free arm, Jessie clears the kitchen counter and bottles and cans CRASH to the floor! He lifts Amy up onto counter as she pulls off his shirt! Amy stops for a secon and takes in his incredibly chiselled physique:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh fuck yeah. She pulls him down on top of her OUT OF FRAME...

dialogues.speaker: MATCH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AMY’S BEDROOM -- LATER THAT NIGHT Amy and Jessie collapse back on her bed, sweaty, exhauste post-coital. Amy smiles, extremely satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Mm, that was nice... Jessie just stares at the ceiling, wide-eyed, his mind bl

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I don’t-- I can’t-- What was that thing you did at the end?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just came up with it in the moment.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Honestly, that was by far the best I’ve ever had.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really? Aww... Amy smiles, a bit proud. Jessie looks over at her, smitte

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I’ve never met a woman like you before, Amy...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That’s because you’re very young and you haven’t met a lot of people yet. But thanks, you’re very sweet.  84.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Can I go down on you again?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ya! Sounds great! Jessie grins and eagerly scoots downward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s very late and the school is dark and empty and omino Then Gwendolyn’s Range Rover quietly pulls up and Gwendol Stacy, and Vicky get out and make for the entrance...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: I still don't understand what we're doing here!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: That's because you're fucking stupid. Gwendolyn unlocks the front door and they slip inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn, Stacy and Vicky walk briskly through the spook locker room, past rows of lockers, until Gwendolyn finds one she is looking for. Using a master key, she unlocks t locker and starts riffling through someone’s GYM BAG...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. AMY’S HOUSE -- MORNING Carrying overnight bags, Amy’s kids return home--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Hello? Then Jane and Dylan stop cold: the house is a disaster. E wine bottles and beer cans are everywhere. Lamps are brok A RANDOM MOM sleeps on the couch. Jane looks disturbed:

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck...? Then Amy shuffles down the stairs, hungover, in her robe.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey guys how was your night?  85.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Fine, how was yours? Amy stops, looks around at her totalled house.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It was pretty good. (then) Oh crap what time is it?!

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: 8 o'clock? Amy winces and races back up the stairs! Jane just frowns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungover, hating life, Amy sits on a therapist’s couch wi MIKE. They both sit as far apart as possible. Across from them sits a very positive THERAPIST, smiling, sunny:

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Good morning! I'd like to start by saying that every marriage is save- able, it just takes two people who are willing to work at it, okay? Amy and Mike nod, not so sure... THERAPIST (CONT’D) Awesome! Let's begin with an affirmation. Mike and Amy, I’d like you to look at each other and say three things that you like about each other... Mike and Amy look at each other, trying to think of 3 thi

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Can I go second?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Sure! Amy, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, I like that you gave me my children. And I like that you pick up the kids after school sometimes, that’s really helpful. And I like that you came to therapy.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Great! Mike, your turn.  86.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, um, I like your spaghetti? And you make a pretty good calzone. That’s two.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Do you have any that aren’t pasta?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And I like that you’ve never crashed the car. Amy just turns to the therapist, tired.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay I know you have to be neutral, but do you see what I’m working with here?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?! What’d I do wrong?! Slightly rattled, the therapist smiles bravely:

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: You know what, let’s try a different tack! I'd like to try a role reversal exercise. Amy, I want you to pretend to be Mike, and Mike I want you to pretend to be Amy, and now I want you to just talk about your days... A beat. Then Mike puts on a RIDICULOUS HIGH-PITCHED VOICE

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (AS AMY)
dialogues.text: Hi I’m Amy all I did today was rub lotion on my face and talk talk talk!

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (AS MIKE)
dialogues.text: What up I’m Mike. Today I made toast in the oven and stared off into space.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: We usually don’t do the voices but, okay! How does it feel to be your partner?  87.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (AS AMY)
dialogues.text: I feel great! I’ve got a super- chill husband and two healthy kids and a beautiful house and a fully- loaded minivan and a closet packed with expensive clothes I never wear -- my life is amazing! I really don’t know why I sit around all day complaining and eating cake!

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Wow. Okay Amy, would you like to--?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes I would. (as Mike) Hey, I’m Mike and I have no idea how good I have it! I’ve got a wife who takes care of everything in the world for me and all I have to do is not jack off on Skype three times a day but I still do that anyway because I’m a fucking idiot--

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Okay guys this has officially gone off the rails--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (AS AMY)
dialogues.text: Actually I’m the idiot! I don’t even know how to work the TV remote! It’s like “Help I’m a girl what do all these clearly-labelled buttons do?!”

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (AS MIKE)
dialogues.text: Hey Doc we've been here five minutes can I splooge all over your computer now?!

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Okay that’s just gross--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (AS AMY)
dialogues.text: I’m too judgemental to ever love someone!

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (AS MIKE)
dialogues.text: I’m too self-centered to ever love someone--!  88.

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: ENOUGH! Enough. Okay, look, I know I started out saying all marriages can be saved...but it ain’t gonna happen for you guys. Amy and Mike look surprised by the therapist’s candor...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You don’t even think we should stick it out for the kids?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: In my experience, parents who stay in unhappy marriages for their kids just end up making their kids twice as unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So what should we do?

dialogues.speaker: THERAPIST
dialogues.text: As a therapist, I’m not allowed to tell you what to do. But as a human being with two fucking eyes in my head, I think you should get divorced as soon as possible. Amy inhales, wow... After a moment, she looks over at Mik

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What do you think, Mike? A long SILENCE, then Mike nods, I agree. Amy nods too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Mike slowly exit the therapist's office together. They stand on the sidewalk, awkward, unsure of what to do

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Can I give you a hug? Mike nods and they hug. It’s actually a beautiful moment.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry too. Then BEEP BEEP, a woman sitting in a parked car on the cu waves at them. It’s the fucking SKYPE WOMAN:  89.

dialogues.speaker: SKYPE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hey Mike! Hey Amy! Take your time!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Tell me that isn't the chick from Skype.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It is. Turns out she’s not as weird as I thought. Maybe all of us could get brunch sometime--? But Amy is already walking away, just over it...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COFFEE FOR THE PEOPLE -- AMY’S OFFICE -- DAY Amy storms into her office, sunglasses on, still angry... finds DALE standing there with a HUGE SECURITY GUARD...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey Dale.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Can I have a hug? Amy hugs him, immediately suspicious...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What’s up with the security guard?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Amy, but I have to positively transition you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What...do those words...mean?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: It means that you used to work here, but now you're transitioning, in a very loving, positive way, to somewhere else that isn’t here.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're firing me?!

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Yuck I hate that word! But yes. I am totally firing you.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Well, you sort of stopped showing up...?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, because I’m part time.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: You only came in once this week.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It’s only Tuesday!

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Amy. It’s Friday. Amy raises her sunglasses and looks at the Security Guard really? The Security Guard nods, yeah it's Friday.

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In appreciation of everything you've done, I got you a gift. Dale hands her a TINY BAG OF COFFEE. Amy just looks at it

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Really? You couldn’t spring for the 16 ounce bag?

dialogues.speaker: DALE KIPLER
dialogues.text: Daryl will walk you out. Good luck on your path Amy--

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I busted my ass for six years and all I get is 8 ounces of coffee?! The SECURITY GUARD guides Amy out as she resists:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck you Dale! YOU HAVE TERRIBLE

dialogues.speaker: LIKE CLOWNS
dialogues.text: As stunned HIPSTERS watch on, the guard wrestles Amy out. INT. AMY’S CAR -- DAY Amy drives, super-stressed, hitting her steering wheel!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fuck! Her phone rings. She answers, irate:  gl.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: STERN VOICE ON THE PHONE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Mitchell, this is Principal Burr. We need you to come in. Amy swallows, suddenly very meek:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes sir I'll be right there. INT. PRINCIPAL BURR’S OFFICE -- DAY It’s a typical Principal's office with class photos and plaques on the wall. Amy and Jane sit opposite PRINCIPAL at his desk. He’s frowning, exuding authority...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You found what?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: We found Adderall in your daughter’s gym bag. Principal Burr places a SMALL ZIPLOC OF PILLS on the desk

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: That’s not mine! And why were you looking in my gym bag?!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: We were tipped off by a concerned parent. Amy stops, immediately smelling a rat...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wait, was it Gwendolyn James?

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: I’m not at, um, liberty to say.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That bitch! Jesus, I knew Gwendolyn was evil, but this is insane!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: Please note that I have neither confirmed nor denied the identity of the parent in question--  What?! 92.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Look, my daughter doesn’t take Adderall, though, admittedly, she kind of acts like she does. Gwendolyn did this to get back at me for--

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: I literally have no idea what you're talking about. What I do know is that Adderall is a Schedule 2 performance enhancing drug and therefore Jane is banned from participating in any athletic programs effective immediately.

dialogues.speaker: AMY JANE
dialogues.text: No! You can’t do that!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry but my hands are tied. You're off the soccer team. Amy and Jane just stare at him, reeling in shock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane blow out of the school. Jane CRIES, hysteric as around them, PARENTS and STUDENTS turn and gawk...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: This is all your fault!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know sweetie, and I am so sorry--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: There is no way I’m getting into a good college now! Soccer was my ticket! By now everyone around them is listening.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, honey, but I didn’t mean to-

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Yes you did mean to! You were tired of being a mom so you quit and you started partying with your weird new friends and blowing off work and -- oh yeah -- fucking my English teacher! Yup, heard about that on Twitter today! Thanks mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy GASPS, mortified. Jane calls out to everyone on the l

dialogues.speaker: HARKNESS
dialogues.text: SEVERAL MOMS shake their heads disapprovingly... ONE MOM, however, nods, impressed, you go girl.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jane, I know you’re mad--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Well this is what happens, mom! This is what happens when moms act really fucking selfish! Their kids pay the price! It’s not so funny anymore, is it?! Amy looks overwhelmed with guilt:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Baby, please--

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I want to stay with dad tonight. Even he's a better parent than you! Jane gets into the car and SLAMS the door. Amy just stand there, destroyed... Then she notices TWO DOZEN MOMS froze the lawn, gaping at her. Amy scowls, hustles into her car and races off...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE LAWN
dialogues.text: GWENDOLYN turns to a group of MOMS, sad and concerned:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Is that really the kind of mom we want running our school...? The moms frown, clearly agreeing with her. Gwendolyn can barely to contain her glee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy anxiously paces on her porch. Mike stands next to her

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If you need anything just call me, okay?  94.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Babe, I'll be fine. I’m at the Four Seasons, they’ve got an indoor/ outdoor pool, room service, 18 hole golf course, it’s incredible.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you're staying at the fucking Four Seasons-- Then Jane storms out of the house, carrying an ENORMOUS SUITCASE, still mad at her mom. Amy smiles at her, desper

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye angel! Have fun with Daddy! But Jane just marches off down the stairs, ignoring her. swallows, trying not to look hurt... Then DYLAN exits, lugging a DUFFEL BAG, an XBOX 360, and a SMALL FLATSCREEN

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, buddy, are you going too?!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: The house smells funny. Dylan hurries off down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know they have a TV at the hotel, right? (to Amy) I’ll see you later. Amy nods, trying really hard not to cry... INT. AMY’S HOUSE -- DAY Amy walks into her filthy house, heartbroken and alone. H home has never been this quiet before. It’s awful and eer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy slowly walks upstairs, touching the FAMILY PHOTOS han on the wall. There are shots of family vacations...and Am and Mike at their wedding...and the kids at the beach... Then Amy passes her kids’ BEDROOMS, and stops. Both rooms empty. It’s just too much, she can’t hold it in anymore.. Amy slides down the wall and starts quietly crying, final letting it all go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s an overcast day. Drop-off is winding down. Then Mike pulls up in his sedan and Jane and Dylan pile out, dishevelled. They make for the school, glum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS SOCCER TEAM practices. On the other side of the fence, JANE watches on in school clothes, heartbroken, be turning away and walking off alone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEAN STACY and VICKY hang a banner over the school entran reading PTA ELECTION TONIGHT...

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Welcome to the annual PTA election!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The auditorium is filled with 300 MOMS sitting in their seats. GWENDOLYN sits on stage, beautiful and confident, to an EMPTY CHAIR that is clearly meant for Amy. Principa Burr stands at the podium:

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: We will start today with our candidate statements. And, as only one of our candidates has shown up, we will start with Mrs. James... POLITE APPLAUSE as Gwendolyn stands and makes for the pod

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AMY’S HOUSE -- LIVING ROOM -- DAY Amy's house is still in shambles. Amy sits on her couch i her bathrobe, her hair all fucked up and her makeup runny from crying. She eats stale pizza out of the box on her l and watches “12 Years A Slave” on TV, depressed... Then

dialogues.speaker: KIKI AND CARLA BURST THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: and stop cold:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Why aren’t you ready to go?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Go where?  96.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: To the PTA election! It’s starting right now!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh God I’m not going to that.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: What?! Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well let’s see, my kids left me, my husband left me, I lost my job, my daughter hates me, all the moms at school hate me, and I am a complete failure as a mother. Who in their right mind would vote for me?! Amy angrily eats pizza. Kiki and Carla exchange a look...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Someone has a case of the Feeling Sorry For Myselfies.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: First of all, your daughter doesn’t hate you, Amy, she thinks you quit on her. And every second you sit on your ass eating really old pizza and watching “12 Years a Slave,” she’s right. Amy guiltily lowers her pizza back into the box...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moms don’t get to quit, Amy! Quitting is for dads!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Preach it sisterfriend!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter how hard shit gets for us moms, we keep coming back for more -- and you wanna know why?!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Because we have low self-esteem!  97.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: No? No. Because we love our kids -- our stupid, selfish, ungrateful little kids -- so much that we will do anything for them!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: We lift cars off of them sometimes!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Guys, I can’t win the election--

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: This is about standing up to the bitch who hurt your little girl! It’s that simple! Are you gonna let Gwendolyn get away with this shit, or are you gonna rise up like a beautiful phoenix and say, I don’t care what you do to me, you fucked with my daughter and now I have to fight you! I will fight you on the playground! I will fight you in the cafeteria! I will even fight you in the ladies restroom if I have to -- I will have justice for my little girl because I am a fucking mom and that’s what mom’s do! We protect our young! Amy nods, jaw clenched, her blood rising...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So get off your gross couch, run a brush through your disgusting hair, and let’s body-slam this bitch! Amy looks up with the eye of the tiger:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: A KEY TURNING IN AN IGNITION
dialogues.text: A hand jams a stick shift into gear! A foot stomps down o accelerator and the Mustang PEELS RUBBER out of Amy’s driveway!  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bad moms fishtail around a corner and ROCKET down a l suburban street! Amy drives, focussed, intense, while Car sits shotgun and Kiki gets tossed around the back...

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I can’t...seem to locate...my safety belt-- EXT. NORCHESTER STREET/INT. AMY’S CAR -- NIGHT A MAN walks his fancy poodle down this quiet street. Then Amy's Mustang ROOOOARS past! The man angrily gestures, sl down! Carla leans out her window and yells at him:

dialogues.speaker: I HATE YOUR DOG
dialogues.text: EXT. NORCHESTER STREET/INT. AMY’S CAR -- NIGHT Amy makes a hard right and flies down a suburban street!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! This isn’t how you get to school--! Then Amy throws the wheel and starts

dialogues.speaker: DRIVING THE WRONG WAY DOWN A ONE WAY STREET
dialogues.text: The girls SCREAM as oncoming cars HONK and swerve aside t avoid crashing into them!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to do this! It would save so much time out of my day! Amy dodges a TRUCK then SKIDS back onto a two lane street EXT. NORCHESTER STREET/INT. AMY’S CAR -- NIGHT The girls rocket up another street when Kiki’s PHONE RING She reads the caller ID and smiles, cheerful:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Oh look Kent is calling me! Amy and Carla exchange a concerned look as Kiki answers: KIKI (CONT’D) Hi Kent how are you?!  99.

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: in their house, getting overrun by their KIDS! One of the TWINS pulls his hair while he yelps into the phone:

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: Kiki the kids are going insane!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I know I deal with them every day! They're crazy, right?!

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I can’t do this! You have to come home!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: You want me to come home...? Amy and Carla turn and gesture back to Kiki: no way! KIKI (CONT’D) B-But I’m going to the PTA meeting with my friends...

dialogues.speaker: KENT
dialogues.text: I said come home now dammit! Amy and Carla gesture furiously, fuck him! Kiki hesitates torn...then she sits up, strong:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: And I said I’m going to the fucking PTA meeting with my fucking friends now stop being such a pussy and just make it work! Kiki hangs up the phone, excited, as the girls CHEER:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Thank you I can’t feel anything my entire body has gone numb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn wraps up her speech in the crowded auditorium.  100.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: .-.and it is for that reason, and the 29 others I laid out earlier, that I humbly request your vote. Thank you. POLITE APPLAUSE as Gwendolyn returns to her seat and Principal Burr returns to the podium. He eyes the EMPTY C next to Gwendolyn...

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: Thank you Mrs. James. Well, it appears that only one of our candidates decided to show up, so--

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The doors at the back of the auditorium BLAST OPEN and AM CARLA and KIKI dramatically enter! Everyone turns and GAS

dialogues.speaker: ONSTAGE
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn’s smile wavers, but she stays cool...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FRONT ROW
dialogues.text: Vicky hits Mean Stacy, amazed:

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Oh my God look Amy came this is so exciting do you see her?!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Yes shithead everyone sees her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, KIKI AND CARLA STRIDE UP THE AISLE
dialogues.text: like total badasses, three-across, confident as hell...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late guys.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: Actually, you’re just in time to make your candidate’s statement... Amy hesitates slightly, whispering to her girls:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What's a candidate's statement?!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I think maybe it's a speech?!  101.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Do you have one of those?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: NO! Five minutes ago I was on my couch watching “12 Years A Slave!" The girls keep walking, trying to stay confident...

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Well I'm sure you're gonna do great.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Yeah! Just speak from the heart! Or whatever! Carla and Kiki peel off and take seats in the front row a Amy walks up the stairs and crosses to the podium, scared She looks at the CROWD staring silently back at her. Amy clears her throat... FEEDBACK rings in the mic...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hi, um, my name is Amy Mitchell, and I am running for PTA President. The auditorium is SILENT. Gwendolyn smirks, not worried.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Keep going. You're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know after the other day a lot of you think I’m a pretty bad mom... Various moms in the audience frown, confirming this...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you know what? You’re right. In the front row, Kiki whispers over to Carla:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Why did we make her do this?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I don't know I think we made a huge mistake!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ONSTAGE
dialogues.text: Amy wipes her brow, nervous, her voice quivering...  102.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Sometimes I’m too strict with my kids, sometimes I’m too nice, and sometimes I’m just a crazy bitch who doesn’t make any sense... A couple MOMS in the audience CHUCKLE knowingly...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What works on my daughter almost never works on my son, and whenever I think I might actually be figuring my kids out, they grow older and I’m back to square one. The truth is, when it comes to being a mom...I have no fucking clue what I’m doing. More knowing LAUGHTER from the moms...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you know what? I don’t think anyone does. SCATTERED APPLAUSE. Kiki and Carla look around, surprised

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think we’re all bad moms. And you know why? Because being a mom today is fucking impossible. Even MORE APPLAUSE. Amy is starting to win over the crowd

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So can we all just stop pretending like we've got it all figured out and maybe stop judging each other all the time...? The APPLAUSE grows. Kiki whispers to Carla, excited:

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: She's doing great!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I know I never doubted her. Onstage, Amy starts gathering steam, her confidence growi

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m running for PTA president because I want our school to be a place where you don’t have to be perfect. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A place where you can be yourself and make mistakes and where you're judged by how hard you're trying not by what you bring to the fucking bake sale. BIGGER APPLAUSE. In her seat, Gwendolyn shifts uncomforta

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want our school to be a place where it’s okay to be a bad mom-- Just then, a MOM stands up, excited:

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: My kids haven’t had a bath in three weeks! All the moms LAUGH and APPLAUD.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yes! We all do that sometimes--! Then a HIPPY MOM stands:

dialogues.speaker: HIPPY MOM
dialogues.text: I confiscated my daughter’s pot and then I smoked the shit out of it! More LAUGHTER and APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Good for you! Pot is awesome--! Then a TIGER MOM stands up:

dialogues.speaker: TIGER MOM
dialogues.text: I drove over my son’s violin because I couldn’t go to another fucking recital I just couldn't! The moms APPLAUD LIKE CRAZY! More and more moms stand and confess their bad mom transgressions:

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESS MOM
dialogues.text: I let my seven year old watch Mad Max: Fury Road!

dialogues.speaker: WAY TOO JEWISH MOM
dialogues.text: When my kids are really bad I tell them they caused the Holocaust!

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK MOM
dialogues.text: I drink margarita’s for breakfast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I slept with my son’s math tutor!

dialogues.speaker: STAY AT HOME MOM
dialogues.text: I secretly got my tubes tied because I don’t want any more kids!

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE MOTHER
dialogues.text: I think I hit someone on my way here! 104. Annnd the APPLAUSE tapers off a bit... Amy jumps back in:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay well you get the point! If you're a perfect mom who’s got this whole parenting thing down cold, please vote for Gwendolyn. But if you're a bad mom like me and you have no fucking clue what you're doing and you just want your school to stop making you feel worse than you already feel about yourself, please vote for me! The moms all jump up and give Amy a STANDING OVATION! Amy nods, thanks! In the front row, Kiki and Carla CLAP WILDL

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: She should run for President of the World!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: (clapping, then) You know that’s not an actual job, right?

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE AISLE
dialogues.text: Vicky CLAPS too, so excited, while Stacy just glares at h

dialogues.speaker: MEAN STACY
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY LATROBE
dialogues.text: Ah blow it out your ass Stacy! Vicky keeps clapping while Stacy GASPS, shocked...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ONSTAGE
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn frowns, suddenly feeling very nervous. Burr returns to the podium and the crowd quiets.. Principal  105.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: Thank you Mrs. Mitchell, for that rousing and completely inappropriate speech. Okay, let’s vote. By show of applause, who would like Amy Mitchell to be President of the PTA--? The auditorium ERUPTS WITH APPLAUSE! On stage, Amy laughs humbled. Principal Burr quiets the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. And who would like Gwendolyn James? Only Mean Stacy and ONE VERY WEIRD MOM stand and APPLAUD. sound is tiny in the giant auditorium...

dialogues.speaker: ONSTAGE
dialogues.text: Gwendolyn seethes, completely humiliated. At the podium, Principal Burr BANGS his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL BURR
dialogues.text: Very well. The new President of the PTA is...Ms. Amy Mitchell! The entire auditorium GOES NUTS! Kiki and Carla race onto stage and jump up and down and hug Amy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun sets, MOMS spill out of the school, amped up f the election. Then Amy exits with Kiki and Carla, laughin

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I still can’t believe you won!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know! Thanks for getting me off my couch and making me do this.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Of course it was all my idea.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: No it wasn’t--!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Not now Kiki we’re having a moment.  106.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You know, it’s funny, I gave up so many things when I became a mom, but I think the biggest thing I gave up was having friends. And I had no idea how much I missed that until I met you guys.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: I know I didn’t have any friends either I was so alone!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, you were pretty much the first bitches at this school to ever talk to me... Amy smiles at her two fellow loners, heartfelt...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m so glad we found each other.

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Me three let’s hug each other for a really long time! Kiki pulls them into a group hug. Amy laughs. Carla smile spite of herself... After a while, Amy notices, on the cu

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN CRYING IN HER RANGE ROVER
dialogues.text: Amy's smile fades, and after a moment, she excuses hersel

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Just give me a second, okay? Amy crosses the lawn, reaches the RANGE ROVER, and gently raps on the window. Gwendolyn looks up, sees Amy, and low her window, scowling:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: What, did you come to gloat?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. I just wanted to see if you were okay.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: (wiping away tears) Yeah I’m fine everything's fine...  107.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Okay, well, if you want to--

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: It’s just that the PTA was the one good thing left in my life and now it’s gone too.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh come on, your life is awesome! You have like three boats!

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh God my life is so not awesome. Both of my parents are dying of cancer and my husband is being investigated by the FBI for embezzling 300 million dollars from Iceland -- spoiler alert, he did it -- and my secret son who nobody knows about is living on the street again and I’m basically the only thing holding my family together but it’s cool everything’s cool I’m sure we'll be fine... Gwendolyn QUIETLY CRIES, a total mess... Amy is floored:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Jesus Gwendolyn, I had no idea... Amy takes Gwendolyn’s arm, really feeling for her... Gwendolyn

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what? I don’t know how to be PTA President -- why don’t you help me out next year? looks up, hope returning to her tear-stained face:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Oh my God I would love that! I have so many ideas!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: All right, good. I look forward to working with you.  108. Amy smiles and turns to go...

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Hey -- I’m sorry I went after your daughter. That was way over the line.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey, we’re all bad moms, right?

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s the only thing you said tonight that made any sense. Amy LAUGHS as Gwendolyn REVS her car to life... She EXT. The INT. Amy Amy GWENDOLYN (CONT’D) Don’t tell anyone I cried, okay?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No one would believe me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Good night, Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Good night Gwendolyn. drives off, leaving Amy standing there, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: AMY'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: sun rises over Amy’s house. It’s a beautiful new day...

dialogues.speaker: AMY'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: sleeps in her bed. Then someone climbs into bed with her. rolls over and sees it’s JANE, looking contrite.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: Hey mom.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hey sweetie...

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I got so crazy about the soccer thing. That was so uncool.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh it’s okay--  109.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: No it’s not. I’ve really been trying to chill out about stuff, and it’s just soccer, right? Screw soccer! Use your hands like everyone else--!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I got you back on the soccer team. Jane stops, sits up: Amy nods.

dialogues.speaker: JANE
dialogues.text: You did?! Jane hugs her mom, so excited:

dialogues.speaker: JANE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God I love soccer soccer is my life thank you!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You’re welcome, baby. I’m always going to fight for you, you know? You're my little girl... Jane nods and hugs her mom tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy and Jane enter the kitchen arm-in-arm, smiling...to f DYLAN working at the STOVE. Amy startles and hurries over

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh no what are you doing?! Dylan turns and smiles, wearing an apron:

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Making frittata’s! You want one?! Amy stares, dumbstruck, at the PERFECT FRITTATA in his pa

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You made frittata's?!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah! You said you weren’t gonna cook for us anymore so I had to teach myself. Try a bite, it’s got basil and a hint of tarragon.  110.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (taking a bite) It’s so light!

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I know, right?! I love cooking! And it’s like the harder I work at it, the better I get, which just makes me want to do it more! It’s remarkable! A beat. Then Amy hugs her son, emotional...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I have literally spent ten years of my life trying to teach you that.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: All right, let go, I’ve gotta go finish my homework. Amy just looks at her son, baffled:

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Seriously: who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is once again morning drop-off at the Norchester Schoo MOMS happily load up their KIDS with backpacks, lunchboxe and science projects before kissing them goodbye. Then

dialogues.speaker: AMY PULLS UP IN HER MUSTANG
dialogues.text: and gets out with her kids. She hugs them goodbye, warm.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Have a great day, guys. I love you both so much.

dialogues.speaker: JANE AND DYLAN
dialogues.text: Love you too Mom. Amy watches her kids walk off together, wishing that time would slow down... Then Jessie approaches, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Oh hey.  111.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Look, I can’t get you out of my mind. I need to see you again as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, Mike has the kids next weekend. Why don’t we go ona proper date?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I'd rather go on an improper date.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Goodbye Mr. Harkness.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Goodbye Mrs. Mitchell. He smiles and walks off. Amy admires the view, proud...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Momma's still got it... Nearby

dialogues.speaker: CARLA GETS OUT OF HER CAR WITH HER HUGE SON
dialogues.text: Frowning, she hands him A TUPPERWARE LUNCH:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Okay, for lunch I made you a hummus wrap with kale, okay? (her kid just looks at her) I know it’s gross but it’s really good for you. I’1ll see you at your baseball game tomorrow night, okay? CARLA’S SON (touched, surprised) You’re really gonna come?

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Yes. I am. For all nine innings. Because I love you that much. The ginormous kid smiles and walks off. Carla watches him

dialogues.speaker: CARLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I still can’t believe I pushed that thing out of my vagina. A moment later AMY and KIKI stroll up.  112.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Morning!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: So: what are we doing today?!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I was thinking maybe brunch?

dialogues.speaker: KIKI
dialogues.text: Or maybe a matinee?!

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: What if we did something that didn’t suck? Just then a WHITE RANGE ROVER SQUEALS UP to the curb, mus BUMPING. Gwendolyn yells out the passenger side window:

dialogues.speaker: GWENDOLYN
dialogues.text: Get in, bitches! I’ve got my husband’s plane for the day! The girls look at each other, and smile:

dialogues.speaker: CARLA
dialogues.text: I think I’m gonna like our new addition. The girls pile into the RANGE ROVER and the four bad moms race off together in search of their next adventure as we SMASH TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: ROLL CREDITS
dialogues.text: As the names of our wildly talented cast and crew scroll we play interviews with THE ACTUAL MOMS OF OUR CAST recounting their favorite memories of being bad parents. Because everyone has a bad mom story. Even your mom.
